description:
It's a small space, but the music, lighting and cocktails work well for it. I'm serious about the cocktails! Lots of Castro bars are known for making simple stuff - vodka cranberry, vodka coke, gin and ginger, etc. But Q Bar will turn out a good dirty martini or lemon drop.

In my last review, I said a lot of things I'll call "heterophobic." Sorry! I think Q Bar has changed in the past two years - events have definitely focused a bit more heavily on making queer spaces. Even dollar drink Mondays - insofar as I've been - have become more subdued. But I do know LGBT people who still have that lingering feeling that this bar is "too straight." Let me at least clarify that: there's no such thing as too straight. The gay community should and does welcome diversity in sexual orientation. It's just that some Q Bar patrons don't always seem that reciprocally welcoming. But my hat's off to management & owners for doing their best with it and changing their event lineup.
author: David S.

description: Horrible bar and experience!!!! I had just walked in from paying the cover charge. I was holding my cardigan (tiny ass sweater), set it on the empty bar where no one was ordering, to tie my shoe and the bartender pushed it on the gross sticky floor and  yelled at me "no shit on my bar".Before leaving that night, I approached him and told him, in a nice tone, I'm sorry if my sweater was in the way, but I would have appreciated if he would have asked me to remove it instead. Now this guy was very tall, I'm a 5'1.. he replied to me saying It wasn't him who did it, it was a customer and that I'm coming at him very aggressively. HE LIED! I saw his whole body fling my sweater at me from the floor and make eye contact with me! And then told me I was being aggressive.. idk his name but that guys is a piece of shit. DO NOT GIVE YOUR BUSINESS TO THIS BAR. It's the same man with the dreads that has been mentioned in the other posts!
author: Angela D.

description: This guy was extremely rude. He didn't want to serve us because someone we were with wanted water. He Tried ripping my phone from my hand when I took this photo of him. Rude as hell.
author: Lupe L.

description:
Reviewer # 389
This place was pretty chill. I went on a Sunday night and it was Latin Dance night. There was a good combination of males and females, which for a gay bar was good to see. The location is right in the Castro district a few doors down from the Bear bar. Lots of people dancing and having a great time. Was super fun to be a part of. 

The prices were good, too... especially for being in Cali and S.F. I pay the same in Boise, Idaho; however, there you got a chip for a free drink, which was bad ass!  2 for 1 drinks... good drinks, too! 

The only thing that I didn't like was that there wasn't a toilet. There are urinals, but I couldn't find a toilet. Where are the ladies gonna go? Or they guys that gotta go go :)~
author: Greg D.

description: Do people really have fun in this place or just come to get drunk or drugged? Anyway, Why do they charge to go in? Lol ridiculousness. Save your money for something better than this.
author: Carlos N.

description: One of the bartenders was pretty rude. I feel like if you're going to work at a high tourist dense area you should be ready to offer some drink suggestions on what's trendy for your bar rather than eye roll & "well what do you want?" The second bartender who noticed me after is given up was amazing though. Drinks are strong which I honestly think is a Castro thing tbh. Not a lot of dancing but it is clean so yay for that. The security is amazing though and very friendly/funny.
author: Susie E.

description: Rude bartenders and horrible service; don't come here. It's a waste of time and money.
author: Abraham M.

description: My third and most recent trip to Q-bar has thankfully changed my view about the establishment (for now). The horrible dread headed queen wasn't behind the bar either, which is worth at least one star. I went to watch a friend perform, and it also happened to be Thursday night (BOGO drinks!) The drinks were strong, it took three of us to finish two drinks.  The club was hyped and I haven't had that much fun in a long time. If the dread headed bartender isn't there, you'll have a great time.
author: Alia T.

description: They steal money from customers, refuse to give you your change and then accuse you of lying. I have never experienced worst customer service. This place is absolute trash. I would never recommend someone go here. I'm so disappointed and disrespected by this sham of an establishment. Terrible. Trashy. Garbage!
author: Rodney N.

description: Of all the gay bars in the Castro, Qbar is up there being one of my favorites. It is pretty small inside, but can definitely pack a good dance party. I love the dj booth, the screens on the wall, and that everyone there is always ready to have a good time. If you are going bar hopping in the Castro, or want to go dancing, then Q Bar should definitely be a spot to stop on your journey!!
author: Ross S.

description:
This place is actually pretty fun for younger people. I go to the Castro every so often and I can't help to notice that the majority of the people who go are an older crowd . Which there's nothing wrong with but this Q bar tends to have a younger crowd , at least the times I've been. The music also seems to be more relevant to music that I know and can get down on the floor to. I think this is a cool place to check out at the Castro with a friend if you're around the area. 
It's kind of small, that's the only thing I'd change but other than that I think the music and staff are great .
author: Joshua O.

description:
Honestly, this bar was one of the best places I try with my friends. The people are really friendly and it wasn't very expensive if we consider the localisation. If I can go back to San Francisco, it's very sure I'll be there again with my friends. The music was good too. Clearly it's the bar of you want tale the dancefloor with your squad!

Cela a été l'une de mes meilleures soirées lors de mon voyage. Si vous cherchez un bar où il y a une bonne ambiance, c'est définitivement l'endroit. Ce n'est pas trop cher comparé aux autres places que j'ai essayé et les personnes sont vraiment friendly.
author: Catherine L.

description:
I was verbally assaulted by an emotionally unstable patron that acted like she owned the place. Not only did the employees not do anything about it, they aided in the harassment. 

This use to be one of the best gay bars in the city. It has gone way down the gutter since they changed the name. It's now frequented by angry little she-boys and wannabe thugs that have ruined the once friendly and inclusive vibe with their laughable/territorial/gang mentality. 

The self-proclaimed leader of this Hitler Youth Gang is the skinny runt with the Aryan hairdo. I get the sense that she has a history of harassing patrons. 

The worst part is the bartenders and bouncer enable this hostile environment by kicking out people that are being verbally assaulted by their regulars. So shameful when a gay bar practices discrimination and bullying.

By the way, this is the only club in the Castro that requires a metal detector. What does that say about the crowd? That's why this place is empty every night except Terrible Tuesdays. 

The Castro deserves better than this. This neighborhood is being ruined by these emotionally-damaged troublemakers and this toxic-waste dump is a perfect example.
author: William B.

description: This bar is amazing I feel very comfortable all the staff are amazing and the owner is great also I love each and everyone of the Qbar family
author: Alicia G.

description:
I love Q Bar!

Drinks are cheap..oh so cheap. Before 9pm, they also have happy hour deals. What else? great music, no frills, not grimy, just fun times. I think after a certain time there is cover, but common, get this. I order 4 shots of tequila and it was less than $30 with tip..that's unheard of at any other neighborhood besides the Castro. 

They have a decent size dance floor and gogo dancers to keep the partying going. Now, with $10 minimum, they also take card. Win win for sure.
author: Diane T.

description: I asked for a glass of water with my beer. The bartender tells me to use my beer glass when I'm done with it for the water cooler on the bar. Really, you couldn't spare an empty glass?
author: Jeff D.

description:
First time visiting this bar. We were here for the weekend. Good music. Good vibe. Good dancing. During happy hour we ordered a jolly rancher & corona. We got a few dollars off..?
Then for the rest of the night we ordered a jolly rancher & a brew on tap. Each time our bill was $17. I thought drinks were expensive.
author: Leina'ala M.

description:
Bartender Thomas ... RUDE . People come to a bar to have a good time and not think about the assholes they work with all day . The LAST thing you need is the egotistical bar tender being a jerk . 
 You put beverages in cups for a living . Relax yourself or get a new job . Maybe something you actual enjoy .
author: Heather C.

description: This place was okay.  The price of the drinks were great by the standard of San Francisco prices I've seen at other places.  The vibe was a little eh.  They also used way too much smoke on the dance floor.  Also, people were smoking in the building which made it even worse.  Security yelled at the few people but it seemed a few people kept doing it.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
I had a fabulous time here, but maybe because it was Pride weekend and I was super drunk already before ending up here!

The music was fun, lots of throwbacks and EDM.
author: Connie M.

description: I love QBar - I really don't have any complaints. The only thing I'll say is that it's extremely small in there and it can get really hot. Other than that, I love it.
author: Jeannette A.

description: I kept getting recommendations to go here when I was in town, so glad I did! Prob one of the best bars in Castro. I had a great time. Great variety of music, good drinks, packed, and friendly people. I'll deff go back when I'm in San Fran again :)
author: Jalisa L.

description:
Had to make a review because of an awful experience with the bartender with dreads.
I'm pretty much a local at this spot, friendly with the staff at this location and hanging out here with my buddies every Monday or Tuesdays here just to have a good time. Definitely not coming back again.

There was an accident where a drink was spilled on my friend and I headed over to the bar to grab some napkins to help out. Picked one up for her and helped her clean up only for the bartender to continually try to catch my eye, looking over customers repeatedly to make a "wtf" face at me. I head over and he already flips, telling me that the napkin had writing on it, and I ask how am I supposed to know that? It was on the counter just like the other napkins. I wonder if he wanted me to check every napkin for writing before I use them? Ended up telling me to "go away" with lots of attitude. Apparently it had a chicken-scratch "tips" written on the napkin for whatever reason.

Either way, extremely rude person. The venue is mobbed with straight people on that Monday, BO for days, and this attitude on the bartender is the real cherry on top of a shit experience.
author: Wing W.

description:
We originally came here because we were told that this was a Lesbian bar - on the night we were there, not the case. We went in with the expectation that this was one of the few lesbian bars in Castro but were greeted with nothing but men and their straight female friends. Nothing wrong with that, just not what we were looking for. 

Drinks were cheap and strong, cover was low to moderate depending where you're from. Bartenders, Go-go dancers and the person taking cover were all friendly. They played a nice mix of hip-hop. What I would be interested to know is where the LGBTQ, POC party in and around Castro because I sure didn't find any :(
author: Jennifer S.

description: Fun bar in a fun area! The drink specials are to good to be true, and the music/DJs are always great! Always a stop when I visit town
author: Davíd V.

description: This place is bad...we are visiting from out of town, we were looking forward to hitting the gay/lesbian bar scene. Instead we got averaged price drinks, poor service, broken bathroom door and vomit in the bathroom sink. Oh.. They also pick up ALL the tables, chairs and barstools at 9pm for a "dance party". Unless your the 2 guests at the bar that the bartender was flirting with. Those guests were the only 2 people in the entire bar who got to keep their stools. P.s. the "dance party" started at 9pm, as of 10pm when we left not 1 single person was dancing. Overall a disappointment, poor customer service, dirty and favoritism.
author: Shalin E.

description: Never came across such rude bartenders in my life.   Never going back.  These bartenders are so unprofessional and rude.  The owner of this bar should be ashamed of whom he has employed at this bar.  Keep hiring trash and you should lose this business and any type of worth you think you think you have in the gay community.  For the folks that still go after reading this don't say you haven't been warned.
author: monica s.

description: Worst experience. In from out of town with 3 friends. We paid cover, ordered one drink each, I asked for a lemon with mine and instantly set the bartender, Thomas, off. He got an attitude, started to say we were yelling, and so on. I stepped away to let my friends finish handling the drink order and he followed me and had me kicked out, I have NEVER been kicked out of any establishment before.
author: Kim O.

description: All bartenders are extremely rude from the long hair tattooed guy to the buff Mexican I will never visit this establishment again took 30min to get a drink I will never duck with this bar again
author: Ramon B.

description:
I always have a good time here, music, cool guys at the door, and everyone just having a good time...with that being said, the missing two stars are for the thieving bartender who has a stick up his ass for some reason. Not only did he lie about giving me my card back (the reason why I know this is because I got an FB message from a guy he gave my credit card to the next day) but this desperate for money jerk decided to add a zero to my receipt. 

So on top projecting a miserable attitude to every person he serves, this "bartender" tipped himself $30 bucks. My advise to you, enjoy the club and use cash because I'm pretty sure he's done this before. Also, you won't have any problem recognizing who he is because his section will be less crowded. He'll be that guy hating his station in life with resting b*tch face and sticky fingers. Cheers, hopefully Q Bar will have this guy kicking rocks soon, until then, DO NOT USE YOUR CREDIT CARD!
author: Sneakrs 1.

description: Came to visit San fan and was told that this was definently a place to visit. I'm from Los Angeles and Qbar is most relatable to Trunks in Weho. Cheaper drinks then it's other Club/Bar counter parts in the street & it's plays Pop/HipHop music with some occasional R&B. It's small but it's not supposed to be big as it's a Bar so It does get packed at certain times.
author: Angel P.

description: I had the worst experience at Q Bar pride weekend. A bar back accidentally threw my 3/4 full drink away while I was standing in front of it at the bar. As he walked towards me I said, "hey you the threw my drink away", we had eye contact and he proceeded to walk away blatantly ignoring me. So I followed him as he walked towards the back and gently tapped his shoulder and repeated myself, then he turned around and said, " don't fucking touch me and don't fucking talk to me". Club goers, my  friends, and I were stunned. I went to the bar and told the bartender who didn't care, he just re made my drink. Moments later the bar back returned, pointed me out to the bartender and started taking crap about me. As they looked over they saw my friends and I as well as other club attendees watching them. By this time, I was very upset. The bar back scurried out the bar avoiding eye contact, then the bartender approached me. He condescendingly asked, "What's your problem, it obvious you have a problem, I made you another drink." I explained to him is not about a whiskey and coke its about their rude bar back and disrespectful customer service. I was so upset. I wrote QBar an email and they never replied so now I'm going to leave a review on every review site letting people know not go there! Music sucked, very bougie staff, and the atmosphere was much like the service I received - shallow, pretentious, and arrogant. There are so many bars in Castro don't waste your time or money st QBAR.
author: DeShawn C.

description: This Q bar is up beat with an allure of a sports bar with all the TV's! The drink specials are pricey but the service is impeccable. It's darker than expected but offers special nights such as Lesbian night and a DJ playing the latest hits with a retro mix at times. As one of the as one of my Yelp friend said yeah be careful with your phone n your wallet as I was sitting there as my cousin went to the restroom I heard someone saying be careful cuz a few people came in to try to take someone's phone,There's is no security during the day they don't check your ID so I'm assuming they will at night.
author: Lizzie G.

description: It fuckin stinks in that bar!!! Smells like something died or is rotting slowly near the DJ booth...
author: Patricia T.

description:
Popped in during happy hour Monday and found out why there were only a half dozen people in there while nearby bars were half full. Tall and bearded with a waxed cartoon villain mustache, the bartender was unfriendly, catty and rude.

No more wondering why it's so empty in what once was a happening place.
author: Dave R.

description:
Cheap, strong drinks. 

Came here with friends before 9pm and got their 2 for 1 happy hour special.  Compared to the  bars out in the Mission, the bars in Castro are a steal!  A lot cheaper and a lot stronger.  While they don't serve those fancy cocktails, they do make strong drinks which can make you feel something!

I find this place is great to start off the night before heading out to go clubbing! and definitely more worth it than going to a regular bar where the average shot alone would cost $10.
author: Jacky C.

description:
It look like Rascal, their bartender need to chill the fuck  out. 
I asked for a Stella, I though he was getting a bottle and I asked for  the tap one. 
Now you idiot, there is music and  is loud. How do you want me to talk, prima donna?! Wtf you think you are? !!Leave your problem home when you go to work. Because if you cannot do your job right is not my problem but yours  Tracy Chapman!! Is bad that this bar never address the problem with the bartender when they are wrong . I ' m not going back.
The manager should care and not let the bartender be aggressive and rude because he had a bad day! Fu@k you Tracy!
author: Maria s.

description: I was trying to give this place a chance but after I buy my first drink and the bar tender complains because I'm not leaving him a tip. Really who does that?
author: Mariathe T.

description:
Honestly, when I went here with my boyfriend, I was already tipsy, but remember a couple of things that I didn't like:

1. The music
2. The super strong drinks

The music that they were playing in here wasn't really music that anyone could dance to. There was no one in the dance floor. I was reading some reviews, and when we went here on a Friday night, it was surprisingly empty.

In regards to the drinks, my boyfriend got me a Moscow Mule (my favorite drink), I expected what I expect from a mixed drink: thoroughly mixed. Not this one, it tasted like straight up vodka shots. Since my alcohol intake isn't as high as my boyfriend's, I ended up giving it to him.

Would I come back here again? I mean, yeah, I'd give it another shot.
author: Aj C.

description:
Two for one drinks!  Friendly bar staff.  Great music.  Just remember to not let your guard down in the Castro.  

Wallet?  --front pocket!
iPhone?--the other front pocket!
Jacket?--pockets zipped and wearing it!
Alcohol buzz?--mellow but still have my wits about me.

Sad but true --this is what it has come to in quite a few bars here in the Castro.
author: Thomas D.

description: This guy was so awful with some of my girlfriends. She was visiting the city. They went in about 7pm (they weren't asking ID by that time)... about 9:45pm she went out of the bar bc she wanted to see the street at night for like 10min, and when she tried to get back inside, THAT guy made her life a HELL!!!!!! He went in with her, I could see the scared look on her face, she couldn't even understand what he needed from her!!! Because he was so unkind and Disrespectful! I'm very mad that such thing happened in San Francisco..
author: Silvana P.

description: Enjoying my weekend in sf! However, unnecessary crowded, with surcharge at the door!  This is very unnecessary to charge someone at the door! It is no fun to begin with.
author: Calvin P.

description: All my friends were always telling me about this place so I finally went there on Monday. Drinks are $1 each and the music is definitely worth it! It was a 80's 90's party with $1 drinks! Who can put a price on that?! I'd come back anytime.
author: Renata F.

description:
This is for the dread headed bar tender. He is VERY mean and popped off on me for no reason. I don't think he's from the bay or understand how things work around here. My friend and I were waiting 10 minuets to be served while he was serving people who came up after us! We watched him yell at a customer cuss the customer out and threaten this customer into giving him a tip. The bar tender did not stop harassing the customer until the person gave him a tip. Then we got our drinks. It was fine and we left a tip on our first drinks being nervous of being cussed out. I don't like conflict. 

I really don't know what kind of person problems dude has but he really shows them off for the world to see. We went to get more drinks. We waited 10 minuets. He came over to serve us, then he literally didn't take our order and swerved us for no reason and served two other groups of people instead of my friend and I. While he was pouring other peoples drinks he was staring at me in the eyes really intense and wouldn't stop. So I stared back. Then he said out of nowhere because I guess I was staring back at him word for word "what do you think you're more important than me? I would never fuck you"
I didn't do or say anything that insinuated I wanted to fuck. It's also SUPPOSED to be a gay bar. I'm lesbian. Your gay. Why would that even be a thing. 

I responded with look can you please do your job. He said "do yours" which I was I had money in my hand ready to pay for some drinks. Then he kicked us out. 
I don't know what kind of problems this guy has, maybe he has some sort of addiction. I think he hates women maybe has some problems with a female family member or some trauma with a woman in his life. Whatever happens with this guy don't take it personal because it's not. He has a lot of problems that he wants to air out and take out on other people in his place of work. I can see and tell he is really hurting and it just sucks. He's living in a lot of pain and denial. Everyone has problems with him I've heard. 
It was just unprofessional, rude, not worth my money or my time. I felt Unwelcomed, afraid, threatened and overall shocked. I was treated really bad. That is one abusive and toxic person and I think it's really not okay to treat your customers like that. I think it's terrible ethics and business practice. It's unethical and dirty. 
I can tell this guy has personal problems that carry a large burden on him. Still no excuse to be abusive or aggressive with people. It was childish and scary! 
I'm also very sick and tired of men regardless of sexuality or maybe just people in general HARASSING ME ABOUT SEX. I don't want know if you would or wouldn't fuck me. That's none of my business it's gross and creepy PLEASE KEEP IT TO YOURSELF. I am SO TIRED OF being SEXUALLY HARASSED. It's unacceptable in a place that is supposed to be about acceptance and love. 
This is a colonized way of doing things. It's fake. It's wrong. It's painful and hurts other people. 

The patriarchy, gender roles and hate is very alive in the LGBT+ SF scene. 
Don't come here if you want to have fun. If you want people to dump their personal life and problems on you then you should come here. 

Everyone else was nice.

Go see a therapist like the rest of us hunny. You're grown and it ain't cute to pop off and be psycho anymore.
author: Katlyn B.

description: Q Bar is fully on point with the music and the bartending staff are absolutely amazing.  Even security is nice......thats a new one to me; but nonetheless is a reason to return.  Thanks Q Bar!!!
author: Jeff C.

description: Music was so good!!!! And service was fast. I'm from Richmond,VA. This was the best experience I've had for my second visit
author: Trang D.

description:
Place was fun!!! Music was great! DJ brought back a lot of the best old school songs! The dancers were enjoyable to watch and the crowd was interesting for sure!! 

Drinks were pretty decent ad only negative it's cash pay only! 

But I'll return!
author: Adriana B.

description: If I could give you a half star, I would. Not one to put bars down, but you guys were the worst. First, you hustled us at the door, saying it was a $10 cover for all the beer we can drink. And we get in and it's only bud light. And the door person also forgot to let us know that it was only until 8, which was 30min AFTER we got there. On top of that, all your bartenders were super sassy. People gonna say, "oh it's just a disgruntled tourist", but no. I have friends who work at bars in tourist areas and not all places are like this place. If you're gonna rob people of money, regardless of if they're a tourist or not, then you're not a place that should be in business.
author: Jenny C.

description: The doorman and others employed by this establishment peddle drugs to the homeless and vagrant. I've seen it first hand. I do not recommend spending your night here unless that's what you are looking for.
author: Chris E.

description: Another great bar to go to while in San Francisco. This place gets packed pretty quickly. The cover is $10. There is a coat check for $2 which is really nice for dropping your purses off. There are go go girls dancing who really know how to move. The music is a great selection. You won't regret it. The only downside is its small.
author: Laloni B.

description:
I waited about 20 minutes to go to the bathroom (there's only 1 bathroom for women)and just when I was next the security guard stood up in front me and said the bar is closed you gotta go so I said I really need to go please! And he pushed me and yelled me asking me to leave the place! 
Who does he think he is to treat people like that! 
I'll never go there again and of course I won't  recommend it
author: Ximena C.

description:
Music was okay very 2009 for my taste but hey I can dance to it so I can dig it! Downfall of this place is the guy that ran up and STOLE MY
MONEY from the ATM while I turned around for a second to give my gf a kiss be careful use the atm there. I told the security guard and they did nothing not cool.
author: Matilde C.

description:
I went there yesterday for my Bday, such a good place! $1 cocktails, pretty good music, you can even dance! I had a great time!

It's such a great idea to have this kind of happy hour on Mondays. The place is pretty crowded, but we had enough place for dancing. The location just near the Castro station and the F Line is ideal. Since it was my birthday and my friends paid everything for me, I couldn't check if they accept credit card or not.

The cocktails were not too soft, not too strong, just enough.
author: Lino M.

description:
Yes, super cheap happy hour surprisingly on a Saturday (until 9 pm) with buy one get one free drinks, but who knows what they're using because I felt like shit afterward. The bar is cash only. There's an ATM toward the back, but obviously there's the annoying $2 fee. I was definitely ignored for awhile as all the boys next to me were served first. 

The dance floor is tiny, and you have to constantly walk through the middle of it to get to the bathrooms if you're in the seated area toward the front of the "club". Online it said Saturday nights are supposed to have 90s hip-hop and r&b but they were playing cheesy 80s rock and early 2000s top 40 instead. 

The only positive things I can say is the doormen were super nice and the crowd is attractive and friendly.
author: Cat N.

description: Chill EDM music which is my jam so plus points. Not so busy on a saturday night. But booze is cheap! Cover $5 coat chat $2
author: Robert C.

description:
Mixed feelings about this bar has led me to give it four stars. I have a substantial number of gay friends and so I often find myself at places like this.

Monday night this place $1 well drinks. This means some crappy vodka or rum for $1. It's really not a bad deal, but beware, you will wake up with a headache!!

The music is so good here. I'm amazed to say that Sunday, Monday and even Tuesday this place is popping with 90s music that will have even the most stubborn wallflower bouncing from wall to wall.

One thing I didnt like, and maybe why I docked a star is the $5 cover on a Monday night. That, in my opinion is a little stupid, but alas. Can't wait to visit again :)
author: Alba C.

description: Disgusting. They pushed their drunk loud patrons across the street. CLEAR OUR SIDEWALKS they said. I wasn't in this bar and didn't fit their profile so was allowed to sit on the bench/bicycle rack outside. Awful. .
author: Darin H.

description:
I'm probably too old to be here on any kind of regular basis, but 4 very strong drinks for 12 dollars in San Francisco is certainly not bad. 

3 stars for the drinks - 1 star for the random selection of movies they have playing throughout the night!
author: Aivy C.

description:
DO NOT EVER GO TO THIS PLACE UNLESS YOU WANT YOUR IPHONE STOLEN! I went out with my friends to QBar last night and someone stole my iphone 6 plus from my cross body bag that was *on my body the whole night.* The coat check woman was nice enough, telling me that two other people had their phones stolen ONE HOUR EARLIER! THREE PEOPLE IN ONE NIGHT IN A TINY CASTRO CLUB! 

If you are a girl who owns an iphone DO NOT GO TO QBAR! I was dancing the whole night, it was pretty packed so I have absolutely no idea when someone would have stolen my phone. My bag was on my body, it did NOT have a zipper, but was latched shut (I thought). Some serious criminals prowl QBar obviously. 

Do you want to lose $1,000 in 10 minutes? Do you want to feel alone and exposed? Because that's how you will feel at 1am outside this DISGUSTING ESTABLISHMENT where thieves prey on people who are trying to enjoy their Friday night and get away from the work week. 

If you're reading this and feel even 1% of the fear that I experienced at Qbar last night, please please please do NOT go there. I beg you. I don't want other people to get scammed and have to shell out $1,000 after being robbed. 

DISGUSTING PLACE I am NEVER going back.
author: Lucy M.

description: This is the place to go to if you want to dance your night away. I came here on a Friday night and the music was popping. Cover was $3, which is not bad at all. The DJ had the crowd dancing with all their throw back 90's hip hop/ R&B hits. Also, they have a tiny seat/stage area on the side of the dance floor that was quite fun to dance on. Crowd was friendly and the dance floor wasn't super packed.  Wish I was here dancing the night away instead of writing this review. But I know I will be back in the future.
author: Lucy Y.

description:
Where to begin. Q-Bar has cheap drinks (cash only), great music, and a fun vibe - one of the best gay bars (it's a club at night). Make no mistake, Q-Bar is TINY, but the right size that it's perfect because:
-You never lose your friends
-Even on a slow night it seems crowded
-The bar is literally touching the dance floor

I've only been to Q-Bar twice but had a great time both times. 

Be warned - the bartenders are picky with who they serve. There's no semblance of a line, bartenders pick those they know or those who have tipped well in the past. They also make no apologies for it.

Last Saturday night there was a $5 cover, I suspect this is standard for a weekend night.
author: Taylor S.

description:
CONSUMER ALERT
This polite email was sent 6 weeks ago with no response:

Dear QBAR management,

My friends and I had a great time at your establishment last night.

There is one significant issue that we all want to bring to your attention before we 
post our honest feedback on Yelp, Facebook, and other social media platforms to warn our friends, colleagues, and other consumers:

1. Your website posts happy hour specials and prices for drinks that are not honored. Many would agree this is false advertising.

2. During "2 for 1" happy hour last night I was charged 4 different prices for the exact same drink:

$7.50 (bartender 1)
$12 (bartender 2)
$17 (bartender 2)
$19 (bartender 2)

Since I was entertaining co-workers from out of town, I did not take this issue up with staff at the time. 

I work in the film industry and provide VIP management services to most of the major film festivals in the Bay Area. Our organizations have patronized your bar since it opened, and we would like to continue recommending it to our tens of thousands of audience members annually.

We look forward to your sincere response and resolution to this business issue.

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.
author: Mr C.

description: Cheap drinks  on saucy Tuesday's but dmn seriously 1 stall bathroom for women's?!!!! I had to wait 20-30 mins twice bc a group of 3 ladies decided to do coke and have a girls time in the only bathroom twice. This place is popping but if the men's can have 5 urinals and share  the one toilet please fix  that. Howtf is there only one toilet for women's????
author: Betsy X.

description: Jekyll and Hyde experience. Early evening bartenders were 6 star amazing. Then after 8, bartender with dreads left us standing for five minutes unacknowledged, then lashed out at us when he misheard tequila for Tito's and stormed off. We walked out. Our posse have been regulars for 4+ years and have had great experiences with the other Q bartenders, and we know Q Bar stands for much better service. But being blamed and treated poorly for a staff member's error is unacceptable. And that kind of attitude ruins a bar not just for our crowd of regulars, but also for his colleagues who do show professionalism and class.
author: Ed K.

description: Talk about terrible service. I ordered a Vegas bomb (very standard: red bull crown and flavored schapps, served as a drop shot) and he gave me something in a shot glass that had gold schlager and something else spicy in it. so I nicely told home that this wasn't what I ordered and I told him what I wanted specifically, and his response was "thats a totally different recipe but whatever ill make it." with extra attitude on the 'whatever' then he again proceeded to fail at making a simple drop shot but I'm not a bitch so I always tip before I even had a chance to grab my money  from my pocket he grabs my arm and point to some random quarter that I guess he thought I left as a tip and said "I just made you a drink for free and you all you leave me is a quarter thanks!" sounding like a complete ass in the process, like I was gonna drop a five for him but he cut that to a two dollar tip that I firmly believe he didn't deserve. he messed up my drink, that I paid for and immediately returned, and he remade it. he didn't make me a free drink. that shits on him.  DEither way don't waste your time here it's crowded and too dark and just extremely unpleasant. do yourself a solid and hit the club's across the street ;)
author: Chloe M.

description: We were there in mid-afternoon before a movie at the Castro. Great drinks, cheap prices and clean.
author: Brian B.

description: Love it! Q bar is a blast! Amberlee is an AMAZING bartender and the security staff is so kind! Great dance environment and all around 5 stars!
author: Shayne A.

description:
I would've given Q' a 3 star rating, but their music selection is WAY better than that of Badlands, Toad Hall, etc...Thank you for playing some proper EDM and not as much of those Top 40 diva re-hashes!! The drinks are dirt cheap and strong!  The bathrooms are located all the way in the front of the club, so when it's a packed night, you can imagine how challenging it is to battle your way up there.  

When going to Q, dress as if it's 80 degrees outside, because that club seriously isn't ventilated well!  It's hella hot.  

Overall, Q is a good time and I would probably start my night off there with some strong cheap drinks.
author: Josh S.

description:
Really? 2for1? 
Don't fall in the 2 for 1 special!! you basically pay for 4 drinks. I order 1 vodka tonic and 1 gin and tonic I receive 2 chips and my total bill was $19  this is not! 2 for 1 I payed in advance for the other 2 drinks! Good thinking Q bar for tricking your customers. 
I will make sure to spread the word!
author: David M.

description: Meh. Drinks aren't super expensive. If you're a guy, you'll get attended to very quickly. There is a cover charge most nights, so it's not exactly the best place to hit up for drinks. Just like a lot of Castro dance clubs, get ready to see lots of exposed body parts, but you know what you're in for when you come out here. Music is hopping, but people aren't exactly dancing, even at 11pm on a Friday night. Beer and liquor selection isn't extensive, so it's not really that kind of bar.
author: Danny C.

description: I never felt so ignored or disrespected. I went to ask if the DJ had a set list or if she took requests and she was SSO adamant about not being able to accommodate. Like LESD THAN 5 PEOPLE WERE DANCING. AT LEAST CHANGE UP THE LINE UP
author: Sheenal D.

description:
All I can say is, if you want to party like it's 1 AM on Saturday but it's only 10 PM on Monday, look no further.  As for the clientele, cute young guys (maybe 80/20 split, the latter being straight, the former being, in this hetero dude's honest impression, better dressed and in better shape) but 40/60 the other way for girls (fewer of them overall though). 

Not to be left out of the mix if you aren't the type of guy to frequent the Castro. you are missing out on a great time. Also seems like a good place to bring a really cool girl you met at one of the less poppin' Monday night locations around town. (or, of course, a really fun guy if you're batting from the other side of the plate)

From now on, I think it's Emily Anne at Rickhouse followed immediately by a 10 min. cab ride to Q-bar along Market Street. no question.

PS: good luck at work on Tuesday, the drinks are strong.  I suggests downing something greasy and filling at Sparky's circa 1 AM before you head home. (they always have South Park on the TV when it's that late too, laughing helps stave off hangovers... FACT! last time it was the tri-pod and wheels episode.  Classic.)
author: Mike V.

description: My boyfriend and I stopped in on a Wednesday. The scene seemed to be a bit younger than 440 Castro but there was not much going on. According to the bartender, their busiest nights include Thursday - Monday. One plus is they have a DJ whom was fairly decent and the drinks were fairly cheap.
author: Anthony J.

description: I visited from out of town a few weeks ago.  We ordered a beer and sat at the bar.  One of the employees came and took our bar stools out from under us.  When I asked to talk to the manager for clarification he was just as rude.  He went back behind the bar and took both of our beers away that we just paid for and pointed to the door.  We could not believe it.  Here we are just wanting to enjoy the Castro and to be treated like that.  Not only will I never again visit this establishment I will not recommend it to anyone visiting.  Based on other reviews read sounds like it's time for management consider the employees they have working for them.
author: Laura F.

description: I love dancing and this was definitely the place to go!  The music is always fun and the staff is friendly!  I have come here several times where I don't even order alcoholic drinks; I'll just drink redbulls and still have a blast.  I definitely recommend going here for a fun time and cheap drinks.
author: Ashley T.

description:
Wow. I never thought that I would ever make a Yelp account but for this review I NEED to. I usually can tolerate bad experiences BUT I had such a bad experience with the bartender here tonight, I just had to share.  I didn't get a chance to get his name but also at the same time I didn't want to. -_-  For description he has a beard and kinda has a muscular build with tattoos.  I'm  also assuming he works Monday night.  

Anyways as my friend and I walked up to him, he rudely asked to see our IDs. "Can I see your IDs?!! " he exclaimed with a bitchy attitude and a face to go with it.  Then I asked him for "Cranberry Vodka." He looked at me and made me repeat myself several times before he snidely and snobbishly corrected me. "You mean Vodka Cranberry?"  Well DUH!!?? Excuse me if my profession isn't bartending but he knew what I wanted.  I just reversed the two words so excuse me Mr. HIGH AND MIGHTY.

My friend and I work on the Castro and after a long day at work we wanted to relax and grab some drinks but after this rude jerk, we will NEVER set foot in this bar again.
author: Soki S.

description: Loud, crowded,  good drinks, but bring your cash.  I usually have a better time at 440 though.
author: Jeff J.

description: Super nice friendly staff , CIP , Christian , Angel and Nora ! Great drinks great gogo dancers and amazing DJs , is Packed Monday s night they have $1 dollar well drinks! . Only bar in the Castro with this offe
author: Simon B.

description:
As much as I used to frequent The Castro back when I lived in The 'Sco, I have no idea why I've never really written any reviews of the spots I frequented. I was indeed a regular here at Q Bar, even before it was the Q Bar. Anyone remember the original B.O.C. days? Yes, back when B.O.C. was the Bar On Castro (not Church), this was the spot! I came on ladies night. I came on other nights. Small spot. Gets packed fast (at times, way too packed). Average prices. Hard pours. Good music. Good crowd (that actually dances). 

Came back as a visitor and still love it!
author: Helen L.

description: DO NOT COME HERE!!! I live in the city and I have friends visiting so we decided to do a Castro tour . I've been here few times before and I've witnessed a lot of TERRIBLE diva SERVICE but last night was simply RIDICULOUS.The bar manager is not only RACIST but he doesn't know anything about customer service. He was making fun of my friend who doesn't speak English and he got so upset bc we ordered twice extra ice I even offered to pay for it since he was giving me such an attitude about it. Next thing I know, security told us we had to leave. WTF?? .. I'm 5'1 girl, 112lb Definitely  not a threat to anyone.
author: Yuel L.

description: More intimate than the others, and no cover. People are a bit friendlier. I'd say it's a winner.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I have been to Q bar plenty of times and had decent experience since its always packed.  last night was definitly the WORST experience me and my friend EVER had.  

What happen? you might ask.  here is What happen!
My friend and I wanted to relax on a Wednesday night and taken an advantage for the happy hour in the Castro since it ends at 9pm.  we walked in since it wasn't too pack.  We stood in the middle of the bar trying to wait for the bartender to come.  we stood there for at least 5 to 10mins, NO ONE CAME or even look at us, well at least the person who was cleaning the cups.  then we patiently wait a little bit longer and some guy came after us, stood next to us, and guess what? THE BARTENDER TOOK HIS ORDER INSTEAD OF OURS!!!!!! we were like did he just take his order and not ours? so we decided to leave!!!!! 

We were pissed off and guess what, we went to Toad Hall instead and we get served RIGHT AWAY WITH A BIG SMILE!!!!! 

i have never feel so rejected or what not in a bar.  I would understand it was busy and you can't tell who's first or whatever.  For goodies sake, it wasn't even FULL and you gonna treat us like that!! OH HECK NO!!!!  I have been working as a waitress for a very long time and you NEVER EVER piss a customers off!!! because you know why?  BECAUSE BAD EXPERIENCE TRAVELED FAST!!!! 

all i can say is... WE WILL NEVER EVER STEP BACK TO Q BAR EVER AGAIN!!!
author: Candice Y.

description: I thought it was a random cover charge amount ($3) which is not much, so why charge it, right? The music was good. Bartenders, great--heavy pours, which is always nice. The go-go dancers, well.... Let's hope they have a day job cause they weren't getting tipped. It was a bit warm in there--i felt like I was in the middle of a sauna.
author: Joshua P.

description: we went looking for a place in the castro just to hang out, with good people watching, this is one place, drinks, stop in definitely
author: G G.

description:
Gay Boys and Booze.  What could be better?  If you're going to have a night out in the Castro, start here.  The Booze is cheap, cash only, and you'll be primed for the rest of the night.

This place is where the party begins.  I was so surprised that it was chock full of people. They have fun music, but did need I say again, the booze is ultra cheap.  

I was so happy to be here and it was definitely the start to a ridiculously great night.  I'll be there again when I'm visiting.
author: Jamila J.

description: They accused me of stealing and then continued  to search me and my friends. They found nothing but still continued to throw me out and my friends for no reason even they found nothing
author: Jenna S.

description:
PRO's
Good location
.... ya thats about it.

CON's
These are things you need to change and fast

1. The fog machine.... it's not 1995, unplug and throw it away!
2. Paint, why is everything black.  Its already a hole does it have to be a black hole.  All black clubs and red lights are so over, update, refresh.
3. Clean, clean, clean.  Your place is dirty.  When people talk about Q Bar the first thing everyone says, It's small and dirty.
4. Get rid of that smoking area!!  Uhhhhh HELLO!!! that's your prime real estate and if you ever look at the flow pattern of the bar you've got 5 smokers in that area and 99% of everyone else huddled at the other end trying to get away from the smoke.  Get rid of smoking and make that into more social space.
5. Upgrade you ventilation, it sucks.
6. Get table and patio service with a card reader.  If I don't have to get up and fight my way to the bar I'll drink more and thus spend more.

Q Bar could be a totally cool boutique bar.  Give the Castro something fresh.
author: Adam H.

description:
I liked this place better when it was Bar on Castro, but nonetheless, it's all good.

Q Bar is a little more gritty, music is pretty decent, drinks are cheap, but the best part: it's all about dancing like nobody's watching!

I was here a couple Saturdays ago right after yoga.  No frills, no makeup, in yoga clothes and all (ha ha).  That's how I roll baby.

I was instantly reminded of how much I LOVE to dance.  The crowd started out pretty tame on a Saturday night but by 10pm the place heated up with some of the best freestyle dancing I've ever seen in my life.  For real.  Made me wanna bust out my moves.

Even more fun, the gayboy go-go dancers took their posts by 11pm.  That's about the time that I had to bounce :( 

It's all about fun times.  Q bar, you'll see me again.
author: Angella S.

description:
Cheap drinks, great music! Super nice bartenders and great crowd.  We were there on a Saturday night and left before it started to get too crowded (and the straight guy I was with was getting his ass grabbed LOL!)  but good place to start your night for the cheap drinks.  

If you get there early enough it's 2 for 1 drinks. Only one bathroom stall for women. Basically the door is open so everyone can see the sink and stall (with door). Long lines! Ugh!
author: Lauren W.

description:
Winning!!! Techno dance mavens unite on the dance floor in your flyest (neon) outfit!
TIP: The bartenders handsomely pour great drinks and are up for being creative. Tip them accordingly!
author: Regina D.

description:
Qbar...  Qbar...?  What's that place?  Oh, you mean the straight bar in the castro that took over the BoC spot?

The one with all the straight people looking to be tourists in the gay hood?  

Oh that one?  Yeah.  It sucks.  

Lame bartenders, and even lamer patrons.  I guess the Marina is too boring for the straight bros these days.
author: Michael D.

description: Great local bar. I love Wednesday nights and they staff enough bartenders to make the night move along at a great pace.
author: Peter F.

description:
I've only ever been here on weeknights, so I'm not sure what it's like on the weekend.

It's a cool bar to come to just to chill and have a few drinks with friends.  It's not overly loud & crazy, so you can actually carry on a conversation.  It's kind of like Badlands' little brother....they have similar music, lighting, and of course video screens.  Also, frequent 2-for-1 well drink specials.  Bartenders are nice and prices are fair.  Be warned though, it's cash only.  

I'm only giving it 3 stars but that's 3.5 stars in my head.  I just can't give it 4 because that's my rating for Badlands.  Q Bar, although a good spot, just isn't AS good as Badlands.
author: Heather K.

description:
It's 7pm on a Friday night. I'm two drinks into the evening, and I'm already feeling a happy buzz. 

Unfortunately for me, my co-workers are the types who could easily drink me under the table without batting an eyelash, so I continued on to Q Bar. 

There is some street construction going on in the Castro, so the entrance is a little strange right now. The bouncer is checking IDs as people are rushing to try to get past. No big deal, as he quickly and efficiently made sure we were all of age. 

I ordered a whiskey ginger. $6, and the bartender hands me two for the price of one. Wow. I was not expecting that. I passed one of them off to a friend, as double-fisting seems like a perfect recipe for trouble. Mine tasted weak, but I guess that's a wise decision. Two strong cocktails would be enough to knock me on my ass, and I prefer to (mostly) maintain composure when I'm out and about with people I work with. 

Again, better to get here early rather than late, as it was much less crowded than our first stop of the evening.
author: Brandi W.

description:
"... you wanna do a shot?"
"YES!"
"A shot of what, ladies?"
"I don't know, surprise us!"

Delicious, pretty sure it had Jager and it was 4 bucks. I'd blindly order it again! I really want to go there an dance.
author: Emily D.

description:
Great music and mixes, great DJ friendly diverse environment for ALL! Mini coat check available, even a smoking room (O_O) and gogo dancers. How much can you pack in this efficient space?

 The neon light shines on the dance floor, with bar tables (more like bar platform attached to the wall). 

If there's a bar in Castro that I will take friends of all kinds, visiting outside the country or out of town to, and to experience the culture of San Francisco is probably this one. Lol, there are a few folks who are completely conservative and unfamiliar with the SF diverse scene that felt awkward here. Lolz It's is a part of the SF experience afterall.  Blows a lot of people's mind

The Georgia's Peach blew my mind. Note "the"
No one makes it quite like QBar. I am a big champagne fan, and won't go for normal sweet champagne cocktails.
But this secret recipe with Wolf Blass Brut, Stoli Peach, Peach Schnapps, Fresh lemon, sugar rim (according to the web, portion undisclosed) is fabulous. The touch of sugar rim (powdered sugar!) is ingenious!! Never thought the smooth powdered sugar would go so well with smooth and bubbly champagne (duh. only clear after this experience). I am a fan! I am inspired to use powdered sugar on champagne now. it's literally like the icing on the cake
author: Dilys S.

description:
ATMOSPHERE is that modern disco feel. Lots of colorful lights. Nothing too special for a bar but definitely at least average if not above average. The bartenders are friendly enough though nothing exceptional. Make sure to bring cash to pay!

They do 2 for 1 drinks if you come early enough. So it might be a good idea to start your night out here to take advantage of this deal. 

Other than the fact that this is your average noisy bar, it's definitely a fun experience to be in Castro. Q Bar is easily a viable option to include in either a weeknight or Friday night out with some friends.
author: Junes S.

description: Christian or Emanuel anyways, this name was given by the only girl behind the bar in May 17 201!!! Name I was given by the only girl working to bar on the night of May 17 2015! Well seriously, me and my husband were there and The guy named by a lot of names above( whichever one it is) gave us a lot of attitude fit visitors we were, so not proper or ha friendly!!!! Never going to this place again!!!
author: Risto M.

description:
I would give Qbar 3.5 stars... I just couldn't decide if I should round up or round down.

Call me a size queen, but my only issue with Qbar is how small the place is. It has a great atmosphere on Friday and Saturday nights, but paying $4 for cover doesn't seem worth it if you're just going to be crammed into such a tight space. If anything, I highly recommend going on Booty Call Wednesdays! It's just as crammed, but there's usually a photobooth in the back with different themes every week, and the music is pretty good.

Additionally, drinks are pretty cheap! Expect to pay around $6-8 for a cocktail. However, the last time I was at Qbar, I asked the sassy bartender to make my second drink stronger. His response was: "But you're Asian so you can't handle it anyway." -__-

On a sidenote: For some reason, I think the Caucasian bouncer with the sort of grayish hair is super hot. My jaw drops to the floor every time I see him... if only he'd let me let my pants do the same.
author: Mark B.

description: My first night in San Francisco, I came here and had such a great time. It was a bit of a younger crowd than I'm used to, but the music was solid -- pop, some alternative, some hip hop -- all good beats. If you've been to CC Slaughters in Portland, it reminds me of that, but with go go dancers. Fewer bartenders than bar backs the night I went, so drink wait was a bit long, but overall a great time.
author: Andrew G.

description: Went in here once for dancing, it was great. Good music, mostly hits you can sing along too. People were friendly, drinks were priced as normal. Left my stuff on a couch and it didn't get stolen. Also had some dancers which were fun to watch. They always have a cover charge, but it's not bad, normally $5 or something
author: Anon Y.

description:
I would have given it five star but dang the girl did not know how to make my drink right. A whiskey sour is not that hard to make.

The night I went on was a lesbian event they host every Tuesday there, it was chill. A lot of lesbians but not of the best and nicest kind. I'll be sticking to San Jose
author: Mariela S.

description:
When this bar was called "The Bar" some years back, it was a fun friendly place with a surprisingly good sound system. The remodel and name change to Q Bar looked promising at first. 5-6 years later, the place looks (and sounds) like it's falling apart, it seems to have become to "go to" place for raging coke-heads of all genders and orientations, and the barstaff looks and acts like they're hating life.

Maybe skip this and wait till the next "re-branding" or whatever.
author: Boogee Z.

description:
solid standby for dancing and good music.

but have to second everyone else... a very clever pickpocket roams the dance floor.
beware.
author: Katie E.

description:
The first time I went to Qbar was on a Tuesday night, which according to their site is 13Licks night, aka "lesbians dance party night". Great specials! 2 for 1 drinks and a happy hour from 4pm-9pm.  Cover was $5 to get in.

I went there with a small group of friends, we all were first timers there and were surprised at how small the bar was. It's sort of a cute tiny dance bar. The bar and dance floor collide. If you like dive bars, you'll like this atmosphere of being close to people. I think the only thing missing is an extra bathroom. There is only one bathroom (in the right back corner), so the wait was long. The bartenders service was great, awesome dancing club music, had a lot of fun at this place as a out-of-state person and my friends loved the atmosphere too. I'm from TN so I don't have much to compare. A lot of cute girls!
author: T S.

description:
CHEAP DRINKS + CUTE BOYS MAKING OUT = AWESOME HAPPY HOUR

Yesterday, 4.26.11, my friend and I needed to kill some time before meeting up with our other friends for dinner at Bisou around the block. Trigger was closed--BOO! And two other nearby bars which will remain nameless was just not our scene. My friend noticed a sign that said, "Q Bar" and with the word "bar" in its name, we decided to give it a look. Boy, did we get lucky...

*2 FOR 1 HAPPY HOUR SPECIALS (4 PM- 9 PM): $7 for two STRONG Tanqueray Tonics (Cash Only)

*Free Goldfish Crackers

*HOT AND FRIENDLY Bartenders

*TONS OF EYE CANDY (Too bad they wouldn't give me a second look.)

*Plenty of Seating with Outdoor Patio

*Trendy Silver and Pink Décor

*Thumping, not Blaring Dance Music

Will I return? You betcha! I hear "Bootycall Wednesdays" C-A-L-L-I-N-G my name... except I probably won't be getting any booty that night.

P.S. - I think I have figured out WHY I'm single, ALL the cute, charming and down-to-earth guys are in The Castro. *sigh*
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
$1 drinks on monday. That for me is enough for 10 yelp stars let alone 5!

I'm not even sure how that makes any money for the bar but whatever....

The crowd is completely mixed between straight and gay. It is a complete crazy shit show though...everyone is staggering around completely wasted but then for $1 drinks that is a natural byproduct :)

To top it off there is awesome 90s music. 

If you like fun add Q Bar on Monday nights to your rotation.
author: Paul H.

description: Way too many straight couples....get the f*** out and go to your own shitty bars, this a gay bar damnit, gonna have to start being aggressive and touching all the straight boys to scare them out cuz the ratios are wack... It's fine when it's one straight couple coming as an ally, but this is ridiculous
author: Andrew S.

description: I drove 2.5 hours to get here for Tuesday's ladies night! I had a great time. I cant find anything womens parties near where i live. Let alone on a Tues! Ill be back
author: Vanessa M.

description: Music was really good but the blonde bar tender with the short hair is super rude! Avoid her at all costs!
author: Reem L.

description:
Booty Call Wednesdays....lets just say that never before have I seen so many hot guys in one enclosed space.  

Fun times.  Cheap drinks too.
author: Joanne G.

description: Can't really review the bar since the bouncer is a jackass. It was my 23rd birthday and the bouncer didn't let me in because he thought my ID was fake. Didn't even ask for a second form of ID. So we went to Toad Hall.
author: Kaitlin L.

description:
I don't club as a recreational activity, and I'm also a straight male who doesn't fully grasp the LGBTQ culture. But the Q Bar changed my understanding of many things.

My first critique about clubs has to be the music (audiophile). All I have to say is that if a club plays Aaliyah and City High in the same night, you know your stuff.

The atmosphere was great, as it felt different from every club scene I've been to. I'm not sure what it is, but everyone that was there seemed to just want to have fun, and there weren't any skivvy guys that were creeping and grabbing women because they're sexually frustrated. 

Well, there was one. But he's an outlier.

I just felt as if there were no judgments, nor were there any assumptions being made about others. I've been to a few places in SF, and felt as if everyone was just making presumptions of each other. I felt as if I couldn't approach anyone. At Q, it was just hanging out, dancing if you want, however you want. Just a fun place to go.
author: Sean H.

description: I checked out the bar while in SFO for a work trip, forgot my credit card on tab with the bartender, and then had to catch a flight to Toronto the following day, and the owners were kind enough to pay international postage to securely mail my credit card all the way to Canada for me. They went the extra mile to hide & secure the credit card within the envelope, and even checked in with me after sending it to ensure I received it. The icing on the cake was that they didn't even bother to give themselves a good tip (they literally wrote in "$2" which wouldn't have even covered the postage), and I had given them permission to be VERY generous considering I was so thankful for their trouble. This saved me the inconvenience of having to cancel my (corporate! read: nightmare!) card, get a new one, and then re-register all my online accounts linked to that card.  Standout customer service.  And I suppose it goes without saying that if I was in a careless enough state to leave without my credit card in the first place, I was obviously having a pretty good time while there.
author: Amber B.

description: So I went here on a Tuesday night and was having a great time until the bartender with short platinum blonde hair told me she wouldn't serve me until I tipped her. I was extremely confused because I had been tipping her all night. She told me I wasn't tipping her because some guy who was hitting on me wasn't tipping her...so she associated me with him. Of course I was upset because I don't know this creeper...so thanks for making me feel terrible for no reason. Smh...I will not be going back to this club.
author: Annabelle S.

description: I used to like this place. However, this weekend changed my perception of the crowd here. Cover charge AND MY IPHONE GOT STOLEN. so lame, and so sad since I enjoyed dancing here.
author: Christine C.

description:
What happened to this place?  Oh wait, they got rid of their smoking section! That little section gave q bar it's character and now it's gone... What a shame. 

I came here one Tuesday night and I really want my $5 back.. The music was an awful top 40 train wreck.  I can't believe I used to actually like lesbian night. It's a nightmare!
author: Jodie L.

description: Boooo $5 cover on a Wednesday! You got to be smoking some crazy stuff. It's Wedneday! Need I say more?
author: Hayden C.

description: As somebody who lives in Los Angeles, I was severly disappointed with the nightlife SanFran had to offer. This along with Badlands is like the only thing remotely that interested me in the Castro. I love that they play "urban" music and the skrippers always be bomb as fuq. Especially the bearded queen who plays barback there. He's so sexy!
author: Sean L.

description: I put my money down & the bartender tried to take it as  his tip.  When I called him out on it he tried to have me thrown out.  I live on this shit holes block & will never step foot through the door.  If it takes writing a review every day I will be happy to do so.
author: Camden Riley N.

description:
I had a great time there but be aware of pickpockets!!! 5 iPhones stolen this night, including mine :(
Great music though
author: Léa B.

description:
here's what it is:

cheap drinks
nice bartenders
lots of dancing
crowded space
guys on tiny stage in tiny underwear dancing

It's a fairly straight-heavy crowd for a gay dance bar...  that's not inherently bad, I supposed (as a straight-identified woman myself, I was glad to be there), but it is worth noting.  

To me, this is an average run-of-the-mill Castro-dance-bar.  Nothing special, but nothing awful. It's A-OK
author: Tarah D.

description:
Un-tiss-un-tiss-un-tiss-un-tiss-un-tiss-un-tiss....

Tiny, crowded, loud, bawdy, flamboyant, gratuitous, full of Castro gay boys doing the slow-and-intense male-mating dance that resembles, as my friend puts it, two peacocks strutting for each other...

BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM....

Rhinestone-laden drag queens sachet by the bar, trying to create their own divalicious catwalks, their hips swishing impatiently...

Wwooooooowwwwwwwwwwrrrrrrrrrrwwwwwwwwwwwwwoooooowww...

Mellow moments interrupt the intense thumping of bass, of 144 bpm's...It's a fun scene, oodles of delicious people-watching, the occassional baby dyke or two sidles by, generally attached to at least one other, the even more occassional presumed-straight couple sacheting by, eager to sop up the vivacious energy of the Castro scene, yet eternally oblivious...

It's a great place to spend just any ol' Wednesday night, I'll tell you....!

Oh?  And THE BEST lemon drop I've had in San Francisco!!!!!  Who knew it would be here of all places?!!
author: Amy L.

description: Ok, finally a place that has a laid back happy hour and amazing music from Little Dragon to Neon Indian. A perfect place to go with friends or just chill an make new ones.
author: Jonathan A.

description: The DJ last night was AMAZING!! They play the 2nd (and maybe last?) Saturday of every month. It was a nice balance between top 40, old school hip hop, and great chic songs. $3 cover and $2 coat check. The dance floor is spacious, and drinks are def affordable. Plus, lots of enertainment from the male dancers. ;)
author: Amanda V.

description:
First bar that we tried in El Castro district on a Thursday night. 
No cover and a coat-check for 2 $ (Finally a place that understands the importance of it...).

This place is really small with just a main room, a bar and two tiny restrooms. It was kind of empty with just a few young locals apparently already tipsy at 10pm. I was surprised about that but I got my explanation later on that night.

They have a DJ playing Pop/Hip-Hop classics with remixes and unexpected tracks, mostly from famous singers but not aired on radio which is a good thing when you're a fan and you wish those songs had been released as singles.

The bartenders are really nice and social. I asked for 1 Vodka/Coke & 1 Vodka/RedBull and got 4 drinks for only 13$ ! Wow. That's how you make a customer happy. I was pleasantly surprised and understood why some people there already acted drunk because the drinks they pour here are strong. They're not playing.

The crowd is "Gay-friendly". 
Some straight dudes with their girlfriends, Gay boys with their female besties and older men hoping to get a chance with the two other categories. 
A classic I would say, but not in a good way. This was definitely not a good night to go out there if you were looking for a real Gay Party. 
But It was still fun.

The mood was so-so. It was a weird atmosphere, people wanted to dance but did not dare to eventhough the music was good. I did It anyway but left early around midnight when people actually started to arrive.

Wanted to try again Q-Bar on Friday but this memory and the 6$ cover kind of turned me off, plus the bar seemed still empty from outside at 10:30pm. Not a good thing.

To sum it up, It's a good place to hang out with friends and get cheap & strong drinks before actually going to a real Gay party.
author: Marc S.

description: I don't understand why this particular bar has SUCH AN ISSUE WITH STOLEN IPHONES. I was here on Saturday night 12/12/15 and had a small purse attached to my body and after socializing for a while with friends realized my purse had been zipped open (which I would never leave it open) and of course my BRAND NEW iPHONE 6 was GONE. After alerting the door guy, he shrugged his shoulders and said "oh well it's an epidemic here in the castro." Real reassuring. The lack of concern and patronizing attitude from the staff was beyond insulting. As I was talking to him, another girl walked up and said to me, "did you get your phone stolen too?" And one of my friends felt her purse move while she was there, looked over and saw a guy standing there, then she said "what are you doing?" and he walked out of the bar. She had her phone in her pocket instead of her purse so he wasn't able to get hers. This is clearly not an isolated incident but a SERIOUS PROBLEM with this establishment that needs attention immediately. A business that allows it's patrons to get robbed repeatedly and shrugs it's shoulders, should not be allowed to operate. DO NOT GO TO QBAR UNLESS YOU WANT TO BE ROBBED.
author: Lisa M.

description:
Q bar, Q bar, Q bar... Where to begin? There are a couple of things that I love about Q bar, but also plenty of things I don't love about Q bar!!! 

Loves: 2-for-1 well drinks on happy hour, the videos they play (hey a girl can still look, no judgy judgy), the music. 

Not-Loves: 
The bartenders: Every time I go here, it's someone new and they always have a 'tude! 

The temperature: Unless you just go for happy hour, this place is a sweltering jungle and condensation drips from the ceiling. Bible!!! 

The bathrooms: 1 disgusting stall in the women's bathroom... Need I say more? 

The Jerk at the door: who always makes you wait, just to make you wait! 

Go here for happy hour and later only if you are drunk enough to not care.
author: Brandy B.

description:
I didn't care that this place was overcrowded the first time I went, or that some extremely-drunk-under-21-lookin kids were breaking pint glasses in the "smoke room" and yelling "MAZEL TOV!"

BUT this one night, I DID mind the b*tch at the bar who "accidentally" sprayed windex or bar cleaner on my arm and even some on my face! She couldn't even give a sincere apology, just chuckled and said "oh whoops". And MIND you I had spent a good load of $$ on drinks AND had been tipping pretty good, cuz I know some of those broke ass hipsters can barely cough up their 5 bucks for 2 drinks. 

OH! and on the night of my girlfriends bday back in May despite bringing in a good amount of clientele (about 13 friends) , we had another b*tch bartender. It was pretty obvious that we were all one group, but he would just take one order then ignore our side of the bar to help -I'm guessing- some regulars he seemed to know. And when we tried to get his attention he snapped in my face and said "I can SEE you, so you DON'T have to be yelling! I will get to you when I get to you". WOW.. i think that was the LAST time we went, and have never been back.

I like their music and drink specials, BUT NEVER again will I return or give my $$ to these disrespectful low lives! they got something up their a$$es, they need to learn to respect ALL customers whether they're locals/regulars or NOT! 

B*itches.
author: Brenda P.

description: Probably the place I go to when in the Castro. It can be hit or miss at times but when is a good night it's a good night for sure. Tuesday nights have the best music in my opinion but alas it's a Tuesday so I don't get to experience it that much. Great drinks cheap price, just remember: CASH ONLY!!!
author: Veronica M.

description:
Made my old Castro rounds on New Years day...had to come here for old times sake. Its changed sooo much! 

Came for lezzy night and the drink specials were on point! My bartender was cute and drinks were half off aka $3 shots of Jameson. 

It smelled like feet in here tho.....seriously? Yall still havent figured out how to properly ventilate this place?! -_-

Music was ratchet...Iggy Azalea, Kreay, early 2000's stuff - It was fun tho. I spent new years day twerkin' on my gay bf lol 

I think they still have that photo area in the back.

Slop-tops galore!
author: Lydia L.

description:
"All you can drink beers for $10!" the girl shouted at us.

Cue cartoon-style screeching tires. It certainly stopped us in our tracks. We paused to listen to WHY ON EARTH we'd get endless beers in San Francisco (!) for so cheap.

"It's to benefit the AIDS/LifeCycle." Well, that just put the cherry on the cake.

In we went and were served endless Miller Lite (hey, she never said the beers were GOOD), while the stereo pumped some sweet dance jams. They were also doing Happy Hour: 2 for 1 drinks. We even purchased $3 jello shots to help benefit the LifeCycle. 

Hey! They were for a good cause! Us getting drunk was just a happy coincidence.
author: Adena B.

description: Fun times! Bright lights. Diverse crowd. Enough room to dance in a big group, not so sparse that it's awkward. Stage dancers in tighty-whities under blacklights. (unfort, we commoners cannot dance up there. I tried. And was rejected) $6 drinks. No cover. Fun, pop+electronic music. Close to MUNI stop. No line on a Friday night.
author: Ziyan C.

description: good 1/2 price full bar drink specials.  Parking is street, free meter after 6, but watch out, 2 hour max...yes they police the area if you park too long.
author: S T.

description:
Mondays: strong $2 drinks, friendly bartenders, inevitable new friendships, loud nonstop dance music. 

Just take Tuesday off.
author: Ally W.

description:
First stop of the night in Castro was spent here. Got there during 2-for-1 HH but, being an out-of-towner, did not know what that meant. We have a bar back home that gives us one drink and then a chip that we hand back in if we desire the second drink but this filled up right away. As someone who doesn't drink a lot, a pear vodka soda x2 left me tipsy and ready to get outta there before I couldn't stand anymore.

Walked in to The Incredibles playing on the screen (wtf?) but the 80s music was pretty chill. The bartender was extremely pleasant and it was nice to people watch for an hour or so. 

Only complaints were that sad excuse for a patio and the blonde-ish security guy. 
The max of 24 smokers at once was definitely not being followed and I couldn't wait to get out of that room or as close to the window so I could jump out and save myself.
Mr. Security was chatting it up with some guy and not paying attention to the max limit of people but did take the time to notice me standing near the door waiting on my wife to finish smoking. He also took the time to berate me for my choice of location to wait for her -- no drink in hand and no one around me that could potentially be bothered. Who knew that you couldn't just stand anywhere you please in a bar?
author: Amanda B.

description:
Only because of Matt O & Luke B....

The place was packed to the rafters (you know when you walk into a bar and you end up stepping on other people's shoes with every step that you take and everyone else does the same as well?)!

Yeah yeah I know.. I'm not gay and Q Bar is a gay bar but you know what? I actually had a great time there so I think it's fair enough that I review it and infact write a review that does it justice. 

The bartenders were great.. too great even because we ended up getting smashed! Seriously I can't remember the last time I got that shit-faced! It was a great night though so no regrets!
author: Kevin S.

description: I've been coming here for so long and today I got kicked out for "stealing two bottles" and when I told them to search me and my friends they told us wouldn't and continued to kick me and my friends out. They just lost a loyal customer.
author: Sofia R.

description: Rude diva bartenders. One called me a cheap bitch under his breathe. I opened a tab thinking i can tip all at once when I'm ready to close it. Guess not.
author: Fiona S.

description:
Music: excellent DJ on Tuesday nights
Drinks: absolutely TERRIBLE
Events: lame

The only reason I'm giving this bar 1 star is because of the DJ on Tues nights - she's awesome!

The drinks are not only bad, but they put low grade cheap booze in the bottles of premium. Subsequently, most of the people who go to Q BAR get sick from the low grade booze. 

Regarding events: I have NOTHING against my absolutely fabulous gay men, but if you say Tues is for lesbians, then you're going to have to segregate (sorry).  Its packed with just the ladies on  Tues, you don't need the extra clientele.
author: Denise M.

description: Cute place when I want to get the dance out of my system but just a pit stop. Ki is an awesome bartender and probably the main reason my bestie and I come to this place. I used to come every Monday but the straight people killed the vibe. Don't get mad that gay guys are hitting on you when you are in a gay bar.
author: Michael H.

description:
A super fun place to be during and after Bay to Breakers... 
...still trying to figure out how two great drinks only cost $6 bucks but I'm not complaining! 

I can't wait to come back just to be a part of the fun, stylish crowd. One of the more female-friendly bars in the Castro.
author: Laura W.

description:
This might be a great pre-game spot before heading off to a larger venue like The Cafe unless you find claustrophobia a turn-on. 

We stopped in at 8pm on a Saturday night, and the place was practically empty, but filled up FAST. The drinks are strong (I just typed "The drinks are fast", I may still be drunk thanks to those drinks), the bartenders friendly, and it's too tight for dancing, so everybody there is on the prowl. 

Depending on your tastes, this might be your new favorite pickup spot.
author: Kevin B.

description:
I sometimes even dance to commercials.

It's true. I've boogy-ed to gum ads, mouthwash commercials. And I'm sure at some point I've even broke it down to AT&T's jingles.

If I detect the slightest of beats - I can't help it. My body leads the way.

So walking into Q Bar is beat heaven.

Their DJ's always seem to be spinning quality beats seamlessly. Jamming "on point" music that you really have to seek out  - in the rest of the city. Current radio stuff that will have you hip-rolling well into the night, sandwiched with some commendable throw-backs.

I've been here a handful of times with friends during the week -  and I tend to go earlier on in the night. Since I rarely stay late - the dance floor and seating booths are always pretty open and easy to navigate.

I'm not sure what Q Bar is like on the weekends and how crowded it can get - but as of now - it's prime dancing territory with talented DJs and a friendly crowd.

If you're bored of jamming to Pepsi commercials - throw on some sneakers and get your groove on at Q-Bar.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Asshole bartenders that hit me because a drink got knocked over while I was near the bar. Won't be back.
author: Autumn S.

description:
BOOTYCALL BOOTYCALL BOOTYCALL BOOTYCALL BOOTYCALL WEDNESDAYS! SRRZZ!!!!! So amazing! Free photos! Awesome backdrops! Perfect for vain image whores, like me! :D
