The music was incredible, the crowd was fab, and I just loved all of it!! In fact, my present profile picture was taken at Bootycall Wednesdays!
author: Christopher L.

description:
This was stop #2 on our night of bar hopping.  There was a short line outside.. the bouncer didn't seem all too friendly (must've had a bad night".  Cover was $2.  It's a quaint place.  They had two male go go dancers... I thought they were alright until someone placed a drink on the table/area they were dancing and one of them kicked the drink all over me.

The music was pretty decent... I wasn't a fan of the people that tried to grope me.

I heard Britney Spears also made an appearance here the day after I was here. so that's some plus points right?
author: Belinda T.

description: 2 for 1 drinks on a Saturday for happy hour! Who does that? Q bar does and it's amazing. They do play the same music over and over again. What made my group laugh is that they kept showing Pretty Woman on the TVs over and over again.
author: Nadia N.

description: The thing that I like about this bar is the dance floor. The way people get crazy as the time passes on in this bar is just amazing. Also, you get to meet some random people.
author: Pratik J.

description: $5 cover charge for stuck-up lesbian night and doorman rudely rushing our decision whether to enter the club or not with no line behind us, yeah right. Get over your lame self. Not the same Q Bar as when I literally worked up the block from a few years ago. Monday night $1 drinks are still a good deal but the crowd is like, Oh.
author: Jennifer V.

description:
Because mother hates gays, I decided to make her mad and boogie my tooshie off in the gayest place I could find. And boy, let me tell you, I can see why she hates them... They are amazing! This place was so much fun, it's no wonder why she doesn't like them. Mother hates fun, she says it distracts her from Jesus, but I think she's an idiot, the filthy homebody!

Anywho, the bartenders made our drinks STRONG. Any they were cheap too, only 5 dollars during happy hour! I danced the night away with men, women, stools, on top of tables, whatever. The only thing that struck me as odd were the well muscled men dancing on top of the tables. Imagine to my shock than no less than 2 of these gentlemen forgot to wear more than underwear when going out. Clearly they must have drinking problems, sheesh!
author: Kevin M.

description: After years of faithful enjoyment of QBar, I will finally say you should rethink your visit to Qbar with your straight friends. Qbar security even confidently proclaimed the bar did not need my friend and I. I am glad he stated this because I will never invite, promote or even mention this place after completing this Yelp post. They represent a venue where you cannot introduce straight friends to the glorious gay world. I was appalled and shaken by the treatment provided by "staff" of this place. They are useless and unbelievably rude. Yelp should create a negative 5 star rating because they deserve this.
author: Thomas L.

description:
An early start for Taco Tuesday turned into a night at the bars in the Castro. Hanging out with my a bunch of my coworkers, I have found myself in the Castro on many a drunken nights -- weekends and weekdays.

Apparently Tuesday is Lesbian Night, where drinks are half off for the ladies and they won't let guys in without being accompanied by a female (I saw them enforcing this rule at the door when I stepped out to make a phone call). The music can be hit or miss in this place (I'm a fan of the top 40), but last night, the DJ was playing the good stuff. The place was pretty crowded with people just chatting towards the front of the place and people getting their dance on as you work your way to the back. The crowd is pretty friendly and everyone follows good club/bar etiquette. I think out of the several times that I have been here, I have only encountered one guy who was not cool.

Oh yeah, another reason why I love this place is because Mondays are $1 drinks!
author: Leana L.

description:
Wow.. everywhere else in the castro is dead on a Tuesday night... except Q bar- and they're charging a cover! Badlands, the Cafe, totally empty. It was crowded and the dance floor was happening. Lots of friendly people, not the skeezy ones from Badlands. It was fun and everyone seemed in good spirit. Thank goodness for coat check. It gets super hot in there and SF weather is always super cold. Much better music selection. 
Doorman has a motorcycle with the license plate easy access... if you ask him nicely he'll let you pose for a pic.
author: Naomi K.

description: This wonderful spot in the heart of the Castro was by far the highlight clubbing spot while visiting San Fran with a couple of my girlfriends. The dance floor can get a bit packed since its one of the smaller clubs in the Castro. But the charm, the best looking guys, and the drink deals made it my favorite gay club by far!
author: Kimo C.

description:
This review is for Ladies Night on Tuesdays.

Pros:

-Lots of cute girls
-Pretty strong drinks
-Outdoor smoking patio

Cons:

I just have one con for this place - this is why it's getting 3 stars and not 5. There are too many guys coming to Girls Night lately! The last few times I've been here, I have been hit on by men. That is NOT supposed to happen on Girls Night!

Ladies night seems to be losing it's girls-only vibe, and that makes me sad. That said, there are still way more girls here than guys every Tuesday, and there are all the aforementioned pros... so for now I will keep coming here. :)
author: Laura L.

description:
Slutty and sweaty. 

On monday nights they have $2 well drinks. It is impossible to exist inside of Q Bar and not be wasted. That being said, you should probably make sure you don't have anything going on tuesday morning.

Only one women's restroom; your best bet is the alley around the corner.

The crowd can vary from too many creepy men there to oggle at the lesbians, to those who do more than oggle, to people you recognize from other places but don't actually know. 

Cheap drinks in the Castro is definitely why you go there. Also, the smoking patio is a plus and the bartenders are all pretty friendly.
author: Amy P.

description:
Revisiting my review after a few more visits. Here's a cautionary tale for the ladies. 

I always come on weekends so I don't know how the other days are like. But Q Bar can always be relied upon for something memorable, whether it be pleasant or an event that makes you wish you had brain bleach. Here is one such event: 

SCENE: Picture a pervy old bisexual...straight...I don't know...just pervy old dude trolling around trying to pick up on young girls. My friends and I came here together for a girl's night out (+1 male DD) and we're all women in our mid 20's. The guy tried to pick me up first, presumably because I look the straightest out of all my friends? I was too tired to humor anyone and he's not the team I bat for, so I turned him away. Thus, he moved on to my friend. She was buzzed so she too turned him away. So third time is the charm. Mr. Pervy moves onto the next friend who's too nice for her own good and they start dancing. 

Since he reeled one in, he thought he had an "in" with us and forcibly grabbed everyone to join in. I really wasn't feeling it and I don't think any guy ever has any right to grab a woman so I quickly danced away...backwards and into the crowd. Seriously, who does this fool this he is? Hugh Hefner? Gross. Minutes later, I felt bad for bailing on my friend and leaving her with a creeper so I turned back to help her get away. What do I find? A highly traumatized friend. In the short time I was gone, he got aggressive and tried to ambush kiss her. He wasn't drunk either, just drunk on his libido. Fortunately, she grabbed our male friend and he pretended to be her boyfriend so the predator left the club because he didn't want any altercation with a guy. 

Acronyms that oh so accurately describe how I felt after hearing a disturbingly graphic recount of the incident: 

At the time: DNW
Immediately afterwards: FML...FHL...
In retrospect: LMFAO (only funny when you're no longer in the moment and your friend has a sense of humor)
Overall impression: WTF...ugh

We also see a few lesbian cougars every time we come here so keep in mind that this place has a tendency to attract older patrons, one of which might be an aggressive pervy old guy going to a gay venue to pick up girls! He's lucky he didn't mess with me because I'm not as nice as my friend and I would've kicked him in the balls. Ladies, if you come here, watch out for yourself and don't let your guard down just because you think you're safe at a gay club.
author: Nancy C.

description:
I'll be gay and to the point:

YAYS:

In the heart of Castro
Modern decor
Great outdoor patio area
Good music (mainly hip hop and top 40)
Friendly crowd

BOOS:

Weak drinks
Dance floor is CROWDED, but you can always dry-hump.
author: Jerome W.

description: My girlfriend and I enjoy the 2 for 1 drinks.  The downfall is that the dance area is small so it doesn't take long before it's packed.  The music is what mostly makes us leave and try a different bar. We just aren't fans of dancing to throwbacks. Just stick to top 40 at least. Just our opinion though. We still come here though and do recommend it for other lesbians to come here on Tuesdays.
author: SamiRoxi S.

description: Very professional service and very very nice service. Thank you Q Bar for making us feel safe and secure thanks to Eric, Jen, and mars. Phenomenal service! Thank!!!!!! We'll be back
author: Cara G.

description:
that lesbian manager is a joke. she kicked my brother out because they got complaints that he was carrying a knife! My WTF aura was glowing! after i made him strip down to his boxers, they still kicked him out. i left feeling discriminated against, which we clearly were. 

also, one of the filipino bartenders is a douce bag because he not only messed up our order but made us pay for the wrong drinks. speaking of bartenders, they need to be more attentive to their patrons instead of eye fucking everyone with a penis. i'm only giving it two stars as opposed to one because wednesday nights they have decent electronic music, not that cheesy enrique iglecias shit. fuck the manager. they lost my patronage.

go to trigger or badlands, that's where the hospitality and non discriminatory staff are.
author: Del O.

description:
I can't decide if I love QBar or if I hate QBar. Today, my hangover from $1drink Monday is making me hate QBar.

It is so much fun to go and dance, but I have never been without having a drink spilled on me or one of my friends. They pack people in so tight that you're bound to be spilled all over. Just when you think you've had it bad, it actually can get worse- my friend was vomited on once. It is like a trashy-wild-movie-dive bar with a glossed over cool bar vibe.

The bar staff always seems irritated. I know that they're swamped, but they don't need to act like Seinfeld's Soup Nazi. Really. A bottle of Bud Light is $3.50. When I order beer, I don't tip the same as when I order drinks because all the bartender does is twist the lid off, and when it's $3.50 I just leave the change. On at least 3 occasions the bartender has shouted at me and told me that i "forgot my quarters" and that they "don't want them." One time, the bartenders even tossed the quarters back at me. C'mon dude. That is just about the most rude thing I've ever had a bartender do. I'm not too cheap to give you a higher tip, you're just too rude.
author: Russell Allen E.

description:
I give it a three stars because the bartender was a jerk. He was trying to give some guy shit when he noticed the guy wasn't going to tip him. When the guy wasn't paying him any attention, the bartender tapped him on the arm to get his attention. Then when he realized the guy was deaf, he shook his head like never mind. So now you don't want his tip because he's deaf!? Ass. What if he was going to give you a fat tip at the end of the night? 

Later I leaned over to spit my gum into the trash and the bar back tapped me on my arm and give me I smell shit face and asked if I just spit. Oh I'm sorry you're stingy with your napkins. 

The customers give Q bar a good energy. The music is pretty good. There's usually always something going on here.
author: Vanguard T.

description:
Main points:
Came here yesterday on a Saturday night.
- Come here early before there is cover ($3)
- $6 drinks, cash only
- They play awesome ridiculous movies from the 70's where everyone breaks out in dance
- The DJ with the mustache and the beret hat (DJ Stanley Frank) is my new favorite club DJ. Awesome funky jazz house music, at least in the beginning. The tempo picks up later, but wasn't there to experience that part.

Seriously though, the DJ was beyond on point yesterday.
author: Jason S.

description: Rude bartenders and pushy bouncers! My friend tried to order a drink and the bartender accidentally made two for him and then wouldn't let him just buy one of them; he was forcing him to buy both even though he ordered one. We tried to argue and he just offended us saying we should know what we want before we order. Basically, a $5 cover for a shitty dance floor and rude bartenders.
author: Christina R.

description:
One of my favorite bars in the castro! 

I usually come here on Mondays for $2 drink well drinks. Bartenders are friendly and make a strong drink. Just remember to tip!!

Music is OK mainly electronic stuff, I'd rather go to Badlands to dance.

It's always packed here!! Even on a Monday night, its ridic

AND, there is only one womens stall...kinda a bummer 

Overall you cant get cheaper drinks than this. If you are looking to get wasted I suggest you come here.
author: emily f.

description: I like the throwback pop/hip-hop music and the dudes in their underwear.
author: Christina S.

description:
"That must be a fire hazard."

"Someone better call the fire depo."

"Oh good lord it was like 20 degrees hotter in there."

Q on Saturdays is the place to go if you'd like to die swathed in bodies and sweat. There is LITERALLY not one foot of space to move around in because they let anyone and everyone in.

Other nights Q is tons of fun. I was here for the Pink Party a few months back and had a seriously awesome time. The drinks were fiery yet drinkable and the music was fab.

Later after seeing the train wreck that is Badlands I'm much more partial to Q. The fact they have no cover is just the brandy on Alexander.
author: Meg T.

description:
I'm at this bar way too often! LOL Located in the middle of Castro. It's a smaller gay bar but great for dancing and hanging out with friends. There is a small smoking section if you need a little smoke break from all the dancing and chat with some friends ;)

Mondays - $1 drinks are the best. Make sure to tip!! Much different crowd than any other night of the week. It gets extremely crowded and there is usually a line to get in so don't say I didn't warn you.

Tuesdays - Ladies' night. 241 for ladies. I always LOVE the music they play on Ladies' night more than any other night.

Wednesdays - I am not out much on Wednesday nights but Bootycall is a popular event that goes on each week. It is really known for their photo sessions in the backroom where you can take your picture with friends or by yourself.

Thursdays - 241 drinks are always a good thing! Also a very fun night to come out!

Fridays and Saturdays - Of course it's going to be busy because these are the weekend nights. Usually a small cover but worth it.

Sundays - I usually work during the day on Sundays but I believe I have heard about beer busts and of course there are happy hours during the day / afternoon. I have been out on Sundays and I always like the music they play on Sundays also! They have some fun throwbacks that always get you singing and dancing.

Love Qbar! See you guys there!
author: Anthony H.

description:
Believe it or not it was my first time at a gay bar. Friday night 2 dollar coverage charge, hells yeah! Guys who can dance, yes please. Surrounded by people who share the same excitement and love for Britney Spears as I do, HELL YES. 

Three words: It's Britney, bitch!
author: Ha N.

description:
I have given Q Bar a couple of chances now and I'm just fessing up to it.  I do not like this bar.  We don't seem to speak the same language Q Bar and me. 

Problems start out early after walking in.  I can do a cover on a Wednesday. Sure, not a problem.  I see the production value going in...but I'm standing at a bar waiting @ near 9 o'clock...and not because there are people in front of me but because your bar is understaffed?  If you're charging a cover, why is your bar NOT staffed?! 

And since I had time to think before getting drunk I had a realization.  Q Bar is a lot like Toad Hall...minus the cool funky Hip-Hop, the patio bar, the accessible bathrooms, about 800 square feet, and (on some nights) the ability to mix a cocktail.  But WITH a mark up on drinks that's kind of astonishing.  A well margarita is $8.  

And then I had another realization.  This location would make a really great G-Star store!
author: Luke M.

description:
Went on a Tuesday with a bunch of friends. 
It was super packed.
The line - or scattered gathering rather - for the girl's bathroom was like a 20 minute wait.
I didn't try any drinks here though, so I can't judge that. 
It was okay otherwise, and I was glad we made it in before they started making people wait outside in the rain.
author: Melanie P.

description:
I almost never go out, but when I do it's usually to Q Bar. And it's not just "going out" it's "I don't remember anything after midnight" in the best way possible. 

Also, I don't know why I ever bother wearing pants here. San Francisco is cold, but dancing up a storm in Q Bar is fiery hot so it sucks to tote a jacket around all night when I'm trying to cut a rug, na'mean?

I'm going to have a self imposed dress code for Q bar from now on: ho dresses only.
author: Crystal C.

description:
I've been here a few times, back in the day, when it was still Bar On Castro. It was a crazy swirling balmy room of drink, dance, debauchery then.

Nice to see somethings haven't changed.

On a Pride weekend Sunday, we walked over to Q Bar after an already-long morning/afternoon of celebrations (and drinking). At 4 in the afternoon, the room was already in a buzzing state of dranktitude (cheapest bar I've ever come across in Castro!) and jumping with dance energy thanks to a deejay that spun an engaging set of hip-hop and R&B (kind of a rarity here, from my few experiences).

While in line to get in,w e got flashed some bubbies; not an uncommon occurrence. It kind of sets the precedence for what mood can be found/facilitated inside. After round number X of shots of Y, we swam through the crowd and took to the dancefloor.

As ever, the narrow room starts to warm up pretty quickly, especially when people are busting moves (dance and non-dance related) all over the place. It gets downright hot. And also "hot". I got grooved up on while one the dancefloor, I tried to delicately deflect it, but was thankfully saved by a friend when she saw me floundering.

I can't, for the life of me, remember what the decor or ambience is like in detail. I do remember there being soundboxes/stages opposite the bar where half-nekkid people dance and gyrate against each other once the music/mood/libations get to flowing.  And the restroom situation is horrendous, barring details. It's just kind of yuck.

When I was a smoker, the enclosed patio out front was a boon. It's also where I think I might have been picked up on, though I'm pretty oblivious to that kind of attention. I probably thought they were just being friendly.

It's always been hazily-memorable and a good time when we've come out to this spot. It's a little bit of a trek for us southbay'rs (especially the drive home), but it's often been worth it.
____________________________________________________
Dance, drinks, flashing bubbies, and Marcello's Pizza a couple doors down. And it wasn't even sundown yet. When are we going again?
author: Mikey U.

description: One of my favorite bars in the Castro. They have a really great friendly bar staff. I always know that when I go here I am going to have a great time.  I like going here for Happy Hour because it's less crowded then a lot of other bars nearby and I can get a seat at the bar and talk with the bartenders. You can always count on this place to have the Giants or 49ers game on the TV. Its a good alternative place to watch a game if you don't want to watch it in a crowded bar. If you've never been here before on a Wednesday night for Bootycall you really should go. It's the best weekly party in the Castro.
author: Steven B.

description: My friend and I were visiting from out of town. We decided to go to Q Bar on a Monday night and surprisingly it was busy! The drinks were inexpensive. Bought 4 drinks for ~$15. The DJ played a lot of music from the '80s and '90s - my fav! The only downside is that they allow too many people in such a cramped space. You're literally shoulder to shoulder with someone. It took us longer to push our way through to the bar than to actually order a drink.
author: Anna L.

description:
Q bar or trigger for Ladies Night Tuesdays? 

Q Bar -- hands down. 

Bartenders are nicer, drinks are better, music is more electronic and alternative, girls are cuter. The only thing Trigger has on Q bar is the dancers and space. But I would much rather have a great time dancing close to my friends and drinking cocktails well worth the price, than being visually lured and being forced to listen to top 20 music mash-ups.  

Q bar has also an older crowd, and when I say old I am speaking in terms of maturity, not age. It's more chill.

Plus Q bar has amazing drink specials. Check out their website.
author: Katie D.

description:
Hurray for $1 drink night on Monday and another +1 for no cover all night.

Definitely a fun, but crowded spot in the Castro. Usually where my friends and I start our night of barhopping since drinks are cheap, music is good, and bartenders are plenty friendly. 

One time, the bartender screwed up 2 drinks for us, ended up remaking the drinks and giving us all 4 for the price of 2. 

Result? I only remember picking up the drinks...
author: Ken T.

description: Got kicked out because i ordered the wrong drink. I questioned the bartender, he called security and kicked me and party out. Gays are mean
author: Jessica C.

description: We showed up a little after 11, and it was packed! $3 to get in, $2 to check in my bag. Best moment of our dancing extravaganza was jumping around to "Barbara Streisand." Lots of techno, with some Gaga and K Perry in between. It got hard to dance as we got close to midnight between people trying to squeeze through and dodging random straight tourist men who were trying to hit on girls, but I still had a super time. If you get the chance, get up on the perimeter to get away from the sweaty, steamy crowd and to show everyone how fast you can shake it.
author: Natasha P.

description:
Q Bar is a favorite haunt of mine when I'm hanging out with friends. This is mainly because a good set of my friends smoke, and this bar has a smoking room. 

Q Bar is I think what would happen if you took Lime's aesthetics, Badland's lighting, music, and bar, and Mix's appeal to smokers. The overall result is quite successful. The bar is consistently well staffed, knowledgeable, skilled at crowd control, and with solidly poured drinks. They've never gotten a drink wrong, and always stay attentive and fast. Interestingly, they're also no-nonsense about even slight rabble-rousing. I've seen them on numerous occasions order a patron to leave. This is actually quite appreciated. 

The music is typical top-40 dance fair, with the expected gay appeal. No surprises here. Still, their sound system is extremely well executed. 

Yes, there are sometimes go-go dancers.

The smoking room is interesting in that unlike the inside of the bar, the smoking room is fully lit. No idea why, though it is quite helpful. The smoking room is also thickly doored, so the noise level from inside the bar rarely bleeds over. This makes it reasonably easy to carry on a conversation. The only minus is that the smoking room is terribly terribly ventilated, so you will come out of there smelling like the world's most eclectic ash tray.

There are really only 2 minuses. The prices feel about a dollar more than everywhere else. Also, the cover to get in tends to be a bit higher than you'd expect, especially on an event night. Outside of these complaints though, it's a solid location.
author: Adam G.

description:
One of the best times I've had in the city was at this little gem! -Yes, I was being the fag hag for the night-

PROS: No line, no cover, cheap drinks (Really? Under $20 for 3 shots of Cazadores? Score!), hot dancers (How fun is that!?), good music, awesome vibes, DAAANCING, seriously everyone was having a good time - you couldn't wipe that drunken grin off my face if you tried, I also remember liking the openness of the place (ie not stuffy/sweaty/gross)
CONS: Puking my guts out in the nearby alley

Nuf said
author: Cassie C.

description: The is place has always good prices on drinks! I love it!!! And the music is awesome!
author: Melvin B.

description:
Here on a Tuesday for Ladies Night. 

Specials:
2 for 1 before 9pm and half off thereafter (for women only?) 

Although Q is located in the heart of the Castro, it was packed with women (emerging from the shadows of the Mission). The crowd was a good mix and the music was dance-y.. just heard Gaga, Daft Punk, Dragonette, Rhianna, some old skool (Tone Loc wild thing, Tony Toni Tone poison). The only downside would be its small size because it was jammed by 11pm, but the close quarters made it easier to meet new people.
author: Mona E.

description: Love partying with the gays! No complaints. Drinks are good, dancing is great, and it's always been a good time.  Hate straight guys that bust into this joint trying to get at the females.  That's why I'm here!!!! To get away from YOU!!!! Please don't ruin my night.
author: Vi T.

description:
The drinks are ok. The pour isn't as strong as other bars in the Castro but still stronger than pours in other regions of the U.S.

The place is small but the jus makes for a louder sound system at night. It's clean compared to most Castro bars/clubs but that isn't really saying much.

The crowds vary, depending on the day of the week. Typically the crowds are drama free unless it's a hip hop night. Typical huh. 

If your a tourist and looking to check out some gay bars in town, stop by. Qbar is a must try. 


I do believe ke$ha and Beyonce have shown up once. You may also see some wannabe famous former Real world guests here.
author: A W.

description:
Pretty awesome! Tiny space but also very cozy.

This Filipino bartender seems to have gotten a bad rap here on Yelp but he was super nice to my friend and I when we went :) He asked us for IDs cause we were obviously freshly 21, even wished me a happy birthday even though it was at least a month ago. He also sweetly commented that we were so young, haha. (I have no idea why that one reviewer got pissed because he was ID'd. They have the right to and it's kind of the law, just sayin')

Generously poured drinks. Great prices during happy hour. My friend and I went on a tuesday so it was 2 for 1 drinks happy hour 4-9pm and half off after 9pm :D during their thirteen licks ladies night. Great music. They had some modern songs with the videos playing like Gotye's Somebody That I Used to Know and also threw it back with some Mariah Carey, the Heartbreaker Remix as well as paid tribute to Whitney Houston with Heartbreak Hotel.

Had a bangin' time. Got comfortably drunk for only about $20 and danced our asses off. Def worth it to come back!
author: Lauren L.

description: Is this a gay bar or a bar for drunk and messy straight girls?
author: R. S.

description: Like it. Bartenders are friendly. Drinks are good and strong. I went on a tuesday night (ladies night/ lezzie dance party after 9pm)  and much fun was had. I got there early when the vibe was much calmer ( and there were still men folk around). It was nice and relaxing for a while before the dance party thing happened. I imagine that's how it is on a typical night. My only complaint is the single toilet in the ladies room and the resulting long line to use the restroom. Also my car keys mysteriously went missing from my bag which I had checked at coat check. Maybe they were stolen or maybe I was too drunk to keep track of them. Either way the staff was little help when I realized they were missing.
author: Britanny D.

description:
$2 well drinks on Monday... That deserves at least 3 stars. Plus the music is usually pretty good and there is a smoker area.

On the bad side, it gets very crowded and staff is kind of annoying (though the bartenders are friendly).
author: Nathan B.

description: cute little place.  good drinks.  nice music.  interesting light show, everyone has green freckles.  not super loud or crowded.  not much attitude. was fun!
author: Brian K.

description:
I remember when QBar used to be fun. I went at least once a week during happy hour to grab a $7 mojito, which was really well made. Unfortunately, after a few months, the quality of the mojito as well as the crowd went down hill until all that was left was syrup, rum, and unmuddled mint leaves. Now, we don't dare order anything else aside from vodka and mixer.

There is a persistent stench of vomit and body odor that hits you right when you walk in. I wish they would do something about that. How difficult would it be to give the place a thorough cleaning? Try to find whatever's rotting inside.

The only great thing about this place now is the fact that their happy hour extends until 9pm, which is probably one of the latest in the Castro. The music is hit or miss. Sometimes it's quite memorable, but other times is just dull electronic. I do love the classic movies they play on the screens though.

It does look like they're putting some effort into special events. But they should try to fix the fundamentals first: fix the drinks, fix the bartenders' attitudes, and please get rid of the Vomit stench.
author: Le T.

description:
Oh. My. Goodness. Felt like I was 21 again in this place, but in a good-strong cape cods, loud techno, peeing in a urinal (backwards)-kind of way! Hey, the women's line was huge...(And to be fair, it really was my friends 21st birthday).

Drinks are strong and reasonably priced, the bartenders are hot (and gay, OF COURSE, story of my life) and there's a SMOKING LOUNGE. I'm disgustingly impressed by this. 

Oh la la. Q Bar!

PS Let's get faggy!
author: Leigh W.

description:
I'm not sure. This place is a hit or miss.

The first time I went during the week I had a fantastic time. Next time I went on a weekend and felt like every out-of-towner was in there. The time after that the music was awful. Yet this last weekend I had a great time with great friends and good music. 

I guess I keep going back because its one of the few 'stereotypical' gay bars in the Castro where I feel I might not get a hand down my pants at any given moment.
author: Eduardo R.

description: Had fun while visiting. Not the cheapest place but met cool ppl had fun music was good.
author: Brandon T.

description:
Q bar,

You rock, yes you do...but WHY wouldn't you let my cousin in with an ID that had only been expired by a few weeks? (and on Tuesday night, at that) Its an ID, not a drivers license. Did her age EXPIRE?

Wack.

Moving on:
Good drinks. Drink specials. Good music (usually). Good fun.

I likes.
author: Miss T.

description:
One of the stops on our night out in the Castro. Nothing special. Apparently it was breakup/fight night because we saw a bunch of couples arguing and/or breaking up. 

Got some free shots of what was definitely probably a bad idea. 
Drinks were reasonable and strong, no cover. 

Music was ok when we got there but about 45 minutes in I felt as though we were listening to the same song on replay. 

Nothing truly outstanding about the place (see opening line), but it didn't suck. 
Not sure it would top my list of "must see" places when I return to SF.
author: Rhonda G.

description:
Oh god. I stopped in here for the "Dollar Drinks Night." It was a Monday night and the club was packed. I figured I would be in for some fun. Boy was I wrong. The bar was hotter than hell, the music was awful, and it was full of grungy smelly dudes. How is not showering sexy? Its not people! Take a shower before you plan on socializing!

Then the so called "Dollar Drinks". This was the first bar I stopped at, so I wasn't drunk or buzzed by any means  (I say this because some people feel like there is less alcohol in their drinks when they've had a few.) I waited in line at the bar for about 10 mins... which felt like thirty. I ordered myself two Vodka crans... at this point I didn't want to wait for my second drink. I leave the bar area and find my friends. I start to drink my "vodka" cran... and instead I start to indulge in a delightful watered down cranberry juice. I saw the bartender fill my glass up with "Vodka." So the only thing I can think is they fill vodka bottles with water. I didnt even finish it. And that isn't normal for me. I want my two dollars back! And the the four dollars I left as a tip! That six bucks coulda gotten me a real "VODKA" drink somewhere else!
author: Jason L.

description:
Cheap happy hour! If you are by yourself, prepare to double fist. Pours seem to be generous. I ordered gimlets (with gin) for my friend and I, and I had to mix it and let the ice melt for it to taste better. Friend got a buzz from her drink, which is good~

Bathroom is really funny. It is not next to the bar. It is to the right of the DJ booth. I totally didn't know it was there. Also, it seems to be coed and there is only one stall and I got squished behind the door because some poor guy was wanting to come in. Sorry. Oh, it kind of smells bad in there, but bearable. It's not a bad bathroom, but I for sure wouldn't want to end up in there or have to endure the wait.

Although it was kind of funny that my friend and I didn't get carded for our drinks, but two girls after us did. Carded from the same guy who made our drinks. I'm not sure what to make of that, because I'm sure I don't look *that* old.

And it is a safe place for the ladies. No harassing here!
author: Hayne P.

description:
Were Byron Katie reviewing Q Bar, she would get over the Story that it should be clean, less crowded, and friendly. 

This is arguing with reality (that it's filthy, jam-packed with sweaty, gropey assholes), and is a losing battle. 

She would instead embrace the Reality that it offers really, really, really cheap drinks. 

This is lucky because heavy drinking is definitely necessary to enjoy Q Bar. 

As a lover of reality, she'd probably give Q Bar 5 stars, but I'll give it 3 stars because I still hope Q Bar will improve.
author: Umilia M.

description:
Love that they have their little smoking area up front, and that we happened to make it there in time for happy hour!  Never have I paid so little for two-for-one drinks that are actually strong [apparently they pride themselves on the fact that they never water down their drinks].  The crowd was pretty chill, and only one unfortunate soul was being carried out at 9pm due to getting a little ass-over-tits drunk.

The highlight of the evening was watching some guy stagger in off the street, drink the living hell out of whatever he had in his hand, throw it in the trash in the smoking area, and stumble back out [staff kindly closed the door to the street after that]...highly entertaining!
author: Katie M.

description: Great place to for dance. Nice music. Nice crowd But bar tender was very rude and no manners ( with Mr. "S" t shirt ) so the rating.  Didn't feel like giving more star because his attitude.
author: Ashwini G.

description:
2-4-1 Well drinks pretty much blow every Drunk Lovers soul BUT $1 Well Drinks after 9pm till close every Monday make any Drunk Lover cum (whether in the club or after the club).  Mondays are ugh, hard to anticipate, trite, monotonous , first day of work for the week, and the death of my weekend so I never really loved Monday.  

Until now I will ride or die for Monday because Q Bar brings everyone alive in that little space with ass clappin, bass thumpin, queens jumpin, and the amazing $1 WELL DRINKS that did not leave me with any headache so shove your Belvedere and Patron up your ass on Monday night and save your bucks for that boo you've been trying to holla at at since 5th grade!
author: Eryka V.

description:
I love this place. It is definitely the spot in the castro. Nay sayers complain about the long lines and crowded dance floor, but that's just the price to pay for popularity. Until recently, I don't remember the lines being as long. 

I have to be honest, I liked it more when it was The Bar on Castro. But now the BOC on church sucks. So as Q Bar, it's doing just fine. Tuesdays are Ladies Night, and my favorite night to go, and even though ladies used to have free admission, and now must pay $2, I guess this can be overlooked. Drinks for ladies are 1/2 price on Tuesdays. 

I gave it 4 stars because even though it's been consistently good to me over the past years, there is definitely room for improvement. 

The bartenders are always nice to me, the bouncers are usually not the most chipper, and the 1 stall women's bathroom has got to change. I suppose it's no different than most bathrooms at Castro bars/clubs.  

Bottom line, if you love to dance and have love for the 'mo's, this is your place. It's not The Cafe, but you'll love your life when you're here. 

Another word to the wise and shameless, if you need to piss and are a girl, go across Castro street to the parking lot and pop a squat. Just make sure to tell the bouncers you'll be right back, or those fuckers will put you back in line.
author: Nicole K.

description:
It's a pretty good bar in the Castro. Not too big, not too small. It also does what a lot of places in the Castro don't do too well... remain a bar where people can chat and have conversations while still having the hooplah of a small hoppin' club.

The drinks here are pretty cheap, but sadly they also taste pretty cheap, having that bottom shelf alcohol aftertaste, though it'll still get you where you need to be by the end of the night.

The outside area is also a nice place to lounge, even for the non-smoking crowd. It's a good stop on a Castro bar crawl.
author: Mark T.

description:
Let me preface with saying that this is a pride review and I have actually never been there as a regular customer. 

Q Bar is fantastic as far as gay bars go. Hell, as far as bars go. Despite how crowded it can get in there you're never hurting for a drink at the bar, the dance floor is always pumpin' and there are mad cuties everywhere (okay maybe that's just because it was pride..). 

 Q Bar was a destination every single night I was in town. In fact it kinda served as our pride "home base" -- which was easy, because they only charged a $5 cover. during. pride. only $5! Can't beat that.
author: Lauren R.

description: Was visiting from Baltimore and stopped in, nice atmosphere and pop music. Fun times!
author: Brian Y.

description: I had a great time here, but I wish someone had told me that this is where you go if you want to get your iphone/wallet stolen.  Mine was taken out of my closed purse, that was on my person the whole time and it sounds like this is a very common occurrence at this place.   Understood that its not the bar's fault, but I wish they'd respond to my emails or phone calls.
author: Emily M.

description:
I went to Q Bar on a Thursday night for a little girls night out. Well, maybe there was 1 guy in the group, but when there's 5 girls and 1 guy, it still counts as girls night out, right? To our surprise, Thursday night was 2 for 1 night. You can imagine how the night progressed when each person was paying $5 for 2 vodka tonics...the double-fisting of drinks quickly led to inebriation, which quickly led us to the dance floor, which quickly led the night an end, because you know what they say...time flies when you're having fun.

I've heard some negative things about the bartenders, but I didn't have any issues on the night that I was there. The guys were quick and pleasant, can't complain about that.

I should mention that it is cash only, so don't forget your dolla dolla bills yo when you're hittin up the club. OH! I should also mention the fat guy on the dance floor getting his groove on with his shirt unbuttoned whilst rubbing his hairy, sweaty body. Not that it's of any relevance to the night that you might have there, but I just thought that it was worth mentioning.  

The reason why I am giving it only 3 stars is because it's nothing special. It's a fun place where you can get cheap wells drinks and dance to top 40 music with your friends.
author: Madeleine R.

description: It's a good LGBT bar to stop on by in the city. Great bartenders and cheap drinks. This bar does tend to get busy on Tuesday nights and the weekends so before. This venue is pretty small too and is not recommended for claustrophobic people to go here. They also have a little patio for all the smokers, which is nice. Not many places in SF have this due to the limited amount of space. I've been here many times but do not live in the city anymore.
author: Ann V.

description:
We came on a weeknight, so it was pretty quiet in here, and it happened to be the night the power went out around 6-7pm a few weeks ago.  The two-for-one well drinks were a steal! I love the cheesy videos playing on the screens, too. 

Bottom line:  I might like Qbar even better when there are more people around, which is something I don't say for a lot of places.  Come by for a cheap drink special!
author: Kellie T.

description:
I dont understand the gay bars/clubs in SF. THERE'S NO ROOM TO ACTUALLY DANCE. It bothers me. 

My co-worker and I went here last nite and we managed to beat this massive line we saw when we did leave. There's no real dance floor to speak of. It kind of is this tiny-ass room/unofficial in between space where people are kind of dancing around...? It's hard to explain. But I mean, I guess the people are generally nice? We didn't really talk to anyone. We didn't get drinks here either because the bar was too full and they bartenders kept going around us. 

I mean, $2 cover is alright, and the music was bad. I wouldn't mind coming here again to get the night started, but considering this is the first time I've been clubbing since January, this place, despite being way smaller, is MUCH better than stupid Badlands
author: Dustin H.

description:
QBar had me at "buy one get one free drinks" happy-hour-hello. Arriving a little earlier than the traditional crowd, I was inebriated by the time happy hour ended, which was at 9 pm. It was a small venue and a real energetic crowd! 

I did not incur a cover charge (granted, I was there pretty early), and downed two vodka-crans for $5.00. Not too shabby. Not a large crowd at 7pm, (DUH), and the place really started getting busy around 9pm. Bathrooms were clean, although the lock seemed a little shady -- who knows though because I was already 4 drinks in and done for the night.

At 9pm, our table was swept away to accommodate more people, and more dancing. Am definitely returning to QBar!
author: Nicole P.

description:
Vile bartenders and bar tender's friends!  
One of the bar tender's friends was drunk and barging her way through the crowded bar area.  She shoved my friend and I told her to watch what she was doing, that she was drunk and nearly knocked someone over.  She spat words that she knew the bar tender and would have me kicked out.  Sure enough, not 5 mins later the bouncers escorted me out and took a photo of me for their 'wall of shame'.   We couldn't believe it.  I'm totally disgusted at the complete lack of moral integrity in this place.  None of my friends will be giving them our business again.  We are all professional women who generally buy top shelf drinks too.  Yuck.  Q Bar is on my DO NOT VISIT list.
author: Sarah M.

description: Came here for my first gay bar-hopping experience with my friend. Loved it! People were friendly, drinks were strong and reasonably priced, and music was good. The dance floor is small so there's not that much space to dance, so be ready for some major body heat. All in all, had a great time here! :)
author: Christine A.

description:
Two words: Happy Hour

My friend Laura moved to SF from NYC not too long ago and she hadn't been out in the Castro yet, so I suggested we go to Q Bar for the two for one drinks and some dancing. We both love to dance.

While waiting for Laura to arrive, I grabbed a stool at the bar.  Immediately, a middle aged woman asked the bar tender for a piece of paper and whatever I was drinking... AWESOME! The bartender poured my drinks, and the woman gave me her email address. She said it was a privilege to buy me a drink and she would love the privilege of buying me dinner even more.

As she was talking, the bartender made eye contact with me and gave a little "are you ok?" gesture, which I appreciated. I gave him a little nod. How thoughtful!

So that was an interesting start to the evening. I graciously thanked the woman (who's probably older than my mom) and slipped her email address into my wallet.

I never emailed her, but that piece of paper is floating around my room and every time I bump into it I smile a little. I so appreciate people with the guts to just approach others...

The cheap drinks got me in the door, the considerate staff kept me there and there was entertainment galore.

What I like the most about Q Bar is that I don't feel out of place there as a woman. When I've been to other Castro bars it has been hard to get service, or the men have been rude to me on the dance floor.  Q Bar really seems like a place where everyone can have a good time.
author: Amy S.

description:
Q Bar is a great place. Excellent sound system. Get here on the earlier side if you don't enjoy crowded spaces. It easily has some of the most happening, mid-week dance nights in SF.. from DJs to the staff and the affordable drink selection.

Considering the low prices on drinks ($1 on Monday, 1/2off Tuesday), I don't understand why people freak out over a $2 cover charge. And you wonder why there is only one lesbian bar in SF? #cheap
author: Natalie N.

description:
Q Bar has two of my favorite things: a great happy hour and fun gays. Well that's really just all the Castro. Love love lovee! Wish they had some bar food though. Although it probably wouldn't have been a good idea because in the time frame of three hours, I probably saw 7-8 drinks get knocked down or accidentally spilled on someone. 

Great times by allllll!!
author: Mimi C.

description:
Love this place! The bartenders are really cute.  There's this blonde bartender there who is always super nice to me and remembers my drink!  I'm surprised she remembered me and what I wanted cause I hadn't been there in a few weeks.  The only thing I don't like is the music they play on lezzie night.  Wish they played more rave music rather than top 40.. I even caught the dj playing the same song twice -_- 
but hey, I just go there for the drinks and hot women.
author: Gaëlle D.

description:
Ah, another gay bar review by yours truly.

In it's former, this venue was pretty disgusting...meaning when it was the former BOC before she rose to "stardom" over on Church and Market.

Now, the venue has taken on a whole new life altogether, and I can't tell you how great it is, personally. It's still the size of my closet, but the new lighting effects, plasma screens behind the bars and what sounds like a new and updated sound system, give this place a completely NEW feel.

I usually only frequent this place two nights a week. Wednesday nights for Booty Call and Friday nights because there's no cover all night. The drinks are always cheap and power packed, and I like their arry of specialty cocktails. Although once I had a blueberry mojito and tasted like something from under the kitchen sink.

Live and learn, kids. Live and learn.
author: Trav M.

description:
I used to go here for Tuesday Lady's Night ALL of the time. I still go now and again.

Pros: No cover for ladies on Tuesdays
CHEAP well drinks... I'm talking like $3 or something ridiculous
HOT bartenders... i.e. Aysha!
GOOD music
Always packed

Cons:
ALWAYS fucking packed! And it keeps getting more and more packed as time goes on I feel. The last few times I was there I was reduced to dancing by coat check, and in the outside smoking area... wow. It was so packed it was nearly impossible to smoke. I had to hold my cigarette above my head almost the entire time. That was when I decided to take a break from the Q. 

You have to have a plan of attack when you to go QBar on a Tuesday night... Seriously. Best protocol for the Q on a Tuesday night:

1.) Hit coat check. There is NO room for your purse or bulky jacket on the dance floor, in the bathroom line, in the smoking area... ANYWHERE. And really, it's hot in there. Body heat people. You don't NEED that jacket. And really, if you are coming here on a Tuesday night... chances are you are a lesbian. Everyone knows lesbians don't need purses. Duh. Get a key chain and a cigarette case. Done.

2.) Hit the bar. Find your favorite bartender, or anyone who is available really. Be aggressive, but not a dick. Order two drinks. Both doubles. Slam one, take the other out to the smoking area.

3.) Hit the outside smoking area.  Omit obviously if not a smoker. Smoke a cigarette, sip on your drink, converse and survey. Take it all in. Yeah, soon you'll be on your way.

4.) Get in the bathroom line. IMMEDIATELY. It's going to be long as  fuck and by time you finally get to the front, you'll need to pee. Trust me. You just drank two doubles.

5.) Regroup your friends and DANCE YOUR ASS OFF.

6.) At the end of the night, REMEMBER you checked your shit... drunk ass.

7.) Drunk pizza next door. Done.
author: Liane V.

description:
I get it... friday night its a "gay" bar but shouldn't everyone be welcome anyways?! I went there last night and should have known I wasn't welcome right from the start when the bouncer didn't want to even look at me to invite me into the bar! I go in anyways despite my not so warm welcome and stood at the bar for 10 minutes waiting for any one of the 5 people behind the bar to serve me!

NO ONE WOULD SERVE ME! I called to get their attention... leaned over the bar... even had a man who was sitting at the bar try to get them to serve me and NOTHING! 

No one likes to be discriminated against. I left and went to the Look Out where I was served with smiles and great drinks as soon as I walked in! 

Will not go there again. Shame on you guys for not welcoming someone just because of their sex. Lame.
author: Arroyo S.

description:
I love this place!  I've been here a handful of times with my boys.  The music is good, cheap drinks, patio to smoke, and you can get on top of the block chairs to dance!  The only downside to this place is that it gets super crowded.  

The last time I went, I met tourists from Georgia.  They were soooo nice and danced with us for a little bit.  

Great place to meet new people and shake your ass!
author: Karen L.

description:
The Q Bar is located smack down in the middle of the Castro, and let me start of with saying that I am straight. Nonetheless I really enjoyed it when i went there. It was a Monday night and all well drinks where one dollar making it pleasantly cheap, and the music was great.

If you are gay the place is even better but if you are straight and not afraid of some tipsy gay fellas then you will be pleasantly surprised because there are girls there or if you come with your girlfriend you know that she will be safe :)

Great place great service! Super cheap Monday nights...5 Stars in my book!
author: misha f.

description: 3 dollar draft beers and two for 1 drinks at happy hour.  Friendly bartenders!
author: Stefanie H.

description:
Bring some friends for a good time! 

Mondays: Not officially stated, but it's practically straight night. Plenty of straight girls and a hand full of Europeans, with a mix of gays. I love it! They mostly play house and electro. Dollar well drinks all night and no cover. Get drunk off of 5 dollars. Yay!  Make sure to tip! Shout out to Brett the bouncer and bartender Dana! Get there before 11 or you'll have to wait in line.

Tuesdays: Mostly lesbians. Still a good time if you don't mind it being extremely packed and sweaty :D Mainly hip-hop and top 100. Fun stuff for 3 dollar cover.

Haven't been on the weekend but I hear that it's the best time to go.

4 stars because there's only one stall for the girls' bathroom and lines get longgggg. blah. I tried sneaking in the men's room but they only have urinals. hah.
author: Deb E.

description:
Tuesday is a great night to get wastey face here.
Dollar drinks! 
Typical gay crowd with dancing and top 40 music, bit a good fucking time. 

Duh, I'll be there every Tuesday.
author: JJ C.

description:
I am still completely in love with Q Bar! It's my go-to when I'm in the mood for the Castro... 
An update... 
Q Bar is a black hole for iPhones. I went back and I guess 3 other people had gone in that day looking for their phones too.. sketchy!!
It's definitely not going to stop me from going... great vibe and cute people keep me in good company. No more phones when going dancing, check!
author: Alyssa A.

description:
Q Bar is my favorite bar in the Castro!  I love coming out on Tuesday nights for Ladies Night. $4 drinks for the sexy ladies, and no cover charge.  They play an awesome variety of music, which is perfect 'cause I get tired of listening to the same Top 40 everywhere else I go. The bartenders are so chill, Aysha mixes up the best drinks and is always on top of her game. It may be a small space but the crowd and the atmosphere (not to mention cheap drinks) always keep my friends and I coming back. 
PS.  Gotta love a higher women to men ratio!
author: Diana V.

description:
Bartenders rip you off and make their own pricing depending on how much they'd like to pocket themselves for the night. (yes I've seen the Mexican guy with tank top with buzzed head by left corner of bar pocket money of drink paid in cash a handful of times and even called him out on it). I have often times also ordered the same drink and the price was different depending on which bartender helped you! WTF

Bouncers who check IDS are rude. Yes I'm talking to you, you ugly Filipino whatever ur name is!

It gets to be over 300' degrees in here as they over populate it with gays against any type of fire department regulation..l. THEY SHOULD BE SHUT DOWN FOR THIS!


It is really really a shame because since the renovation they had from the former BOC.. Qbar did have potential... But no... They opted to staff it with incompetent thieves!


P.S. JUST FOR THE REASON THEY ONLY TAKE CASH YOU SHOULD AVOID THIS PLACE. IT SUCKS... go to trigger instead. Way better service and they actually take cards...
author: NC B.

description: The 2 drinks for $2.00 special on Tuesdays makes this the prime place to pregame before heading out to the bars and clubs in the Castro. Love!
author: Ethan G.

description:
Okay, I'm definitely bringing this review up now. Let me tell you....

I always loved Q Bar - the music, the environment, the people, the location - awesome! Unfortunately, something bad happened to me there... theft.

Good news though - Q Bar management has been very helpful in assisting me with figuring out who committed this crime. Although we haven't been able to find them, I know they are doing everything they can to prevent this from occurring in the future.

Now they have video surveillance and of course security (as they had before) and are even working with the police on issues like mine.

I am pleased that they contacted me personally and we were able to work out a time to meet and talk about what happened, and they even gave me a few drinks. :)

I'm back to love for this place, and I still think it's the coolest in Castro. Unfortunately crime is everywhere... but I do feel that Q Bar is doing everything they can to prevent it.

To anyone with something you don't want to lose: if there is a precaution you can take to protect your possessions, take it, but have fun :)
author: Jason B.

description:
Shit, this place is awesome.

I mean look, they have platforms with poles for ya'll hos to show off.

They got a cozy dance floor and a smoking patio (no I don't smoke but I'm sure 95% of everyone in sf does). They also have a bench in the back where you can stash your jackets/snuck in bottle of vodka(it's possible) if you feel no one is going to be five fingering that shit, which pretty much hasn't happened to me before.

They're mix of music is pretty superior. They play dance hits top 40 but switch it up to old school hits and 80's omg yes I'm feelin' myself.

I go on ladies night aka lesbian night aka hella free alcohol when you're with a bunch of girls. The lady bartender kept giving us extra alcohol in our drinks while giving us playfully winks to bedevil us.

Also, there's no cover. Also, drinks are in the non-ridiculous $4-5 range. 

I pretty much have fun every time, until someone gets too drink happy and gets kicked out and you have to take care of them the whole night as they kick and scream and cry and generally be a walking ruckus.

But such is the consequences of the fire-water.

Come to Q-Bar. It's fun.
author: Sunny M.

description:
This is strictly a MONDAY NIGHT ONLY REVIEW!!

I'm going to be 100% angus beef with you, this place is supreme on Mondays if you like to just get shitty and listen to a good dj (Wanted and/or Richie Panic) remix electronic/house music. Drinks are a dollar....yes, a DOLLAR...and yes, they use incredibly shitty alcohol that I've never even heard of (great for horrible Tuesday mornings).

CASH ONLY PEOPLE.

Did I mention that it gets packed beyond belief? Good, 'cause it does. You're going to get SWEATY, bumped, massaged, rubbed, and most likely prodded at least once if you go on a Monday. Some people like that! Some people don't, so don't go. Or maybe you should go.

If you're wondering why I'm only writing on behalf of Mondays, it's because once you go to a place for $1 drinks, why the hell would you go any other day?
author: Kevin B.

description:
If i could just make this review one long, ecstatic and slightly effeminate squeal, I would.

Oh Qbar, I remember you in your former incantation as the Bar on Castro aka the birthplace of my fag haggishness. I recently returned here on a Thursday for my favorite skinny bitch's birthday (HAPPY BIRTHDAY JOSHUA AHGFGAGHGHGHIOYFB!!) because it was 90's night... and baby girl loves him some 90's music. They played all my jams plus some and soon I was feeling like I was back at my Jr. High Sadie Hawkins dance (Toni Braxton and Lisa Lisa always gets me sentimental). 

Good lord almighty, I was in love love love love love with the playlist that night, the kind of love you would marry someone and give your backdoor virginity to. The kind of love I felt for the music basically encompasses my love for Joshua L. The kind of love that inspires women to go out to dance even when they are 8.5 months pregnant. The kind of love that's deeper than the vogue offs that were happening in the corner. The kind of love that tells you to your face that your triflin because they care about you that much.

It was also the night of 2 of 1 drinks.Yes sister, I said TWO for ONE drinks. My friend came back to the table with 6 drinks for less than the price of a back alley reach around (FYI: $17). You know it's a good night when there is a collective freak out when "My Boo" comes on and everyone dances with their hands in the air and their eyes closed. But you know it's an AMAZING night when your 8.5 month preggers friend almost goes into induced labor when Salt n Pepa's "Push It" comes on. (OHH BAYBAY BAYBAY indeed!!) I lightweight wished that Maya would give birth right there so her future baby's memoir could start out "I was born on the dance floor of a gay bar".

It was a beautiful night in the gayborhood. 
SQUEALLLLLLLLL!!!!!!
author: Mary F.

description:
I think the guy who spins Saturday nights here is pretty legit. His transitions are really good in his mixes and although he plays too much Gaga, he combines it with some dirty beats from the underground.

That said, this bar tends to be full of trashy girls looking to rise up in the ranks of fag-hagdom, and boys looking for the next lay. There's a lot of grossness, especially in the form of very unattractive, horrible dancers (mostly girls) dancing on tables, platforms, what have you. I was getting dirty looks from really obese girls that thought I was stealing away their gay boyfriend, little did they realize that he was kind of the person who brought me there this evening. Also, the bartenders tend to be pretty rude once you become drunker and sweatier, and they will be much nicer to your gay boyfriend than they will be to you. That's just how it is.

The redeeming qualities of this bar include: friendly gays having a good time and being nice to you (if you're not a fat bitch), good dance music, the butt-ass naked man smoking a cigarette nonchalantly out front about 60% of the time, the proximity to Nizario's pizza and Hot Cookie.
author: Y K.

description: This bar needs to find a little more space... somewhere.  Once you get in through the long padded hallway and past the window to the smoker's room you find yourself in your typical Castro bar but the music is substantially better.  Although this club plays the hits from top 40 artists when it needs to, you'll actually find REAL Deejays spinning tracks from all genres and making you bob your head to the beat.  The bartenders get the job done - neither friendly or mean and mostly straight so don't get your hopes up boys.
author: Kevin J.

description:
This was my first experience at a gay bar. I loved it! 

Steven, one of the bartenders, is absolutely awesome. He has perfected his mixology. Yes, he hooks it up with the drinks!

The music is great. The crowd friendly. I'd definitely return.

Also, the interior is lovely. Probably the best bar that I've been to.

Only con---cash only.
author: Joy L.

description: Came here with a couple of friends on a late afternoon to relax with a few drinks after a long day and will not be returning. We came in, had our I.D.'s checked by the bartender (had a beard, average build, few tattoos), and sat down. We noticed that the sign said "cash only" so we decided to go to find the nearest ATM. We felt awkward for just leaving, so my friend let the bartender know "Hey we're just gonna stop by the ATM and come back". With an incredibly sarcastic and rude tone the bartender goes "yeah sure". As we're walking out we see him and his friends snickering at us. Seriously dude? Your bar is dead and you think it's a good idea to give a shallow attitude towards your customers. That was an instant red flag so we went over to another bar down the street with a much friendlier atmosphere. After reading all the reviews about what I'm assuming is the same bartender, we definitely made a good decision of not squandering our money here. I'm honestly surprised he hasn't been let go from his job for giving such bad customer service to so many people.
author: Darius N.

description:
If only Q Bar was bigger! I think Q Bar rotates some of the best local DJ's who spin an eclectic mix of dance music. The musical ambition is definitely larger than dance floor and I think it often goes unnoticed and underappreciated. 

The staff here is always down. They are friendly but don't seem to take crap from messy drunks, which I appreciate. 

When this place goes off, call the fire marshal (not seriously...well maybe), it gets crowded! Its all part of the experience, trying to move from bar to your desired 'spot' and bumping into just about half of San Francisco from point A to point B. They have opened it up a little more with the design and they can't get the tables and chairs out of there fast enough some nights. Check out the smoking patio in the front for a break from the madness, even if you don't smoke.

There is usually no cover or maybe a $2 one at night. Great place to lose your hearing and forget your troubles. 

Daytime weekend visits can be festive, too, and less crowded and more conducive to conversations.
author: Scott A.

description:
How have I not already written a review for Q Bar?  This place has been my go to bar since I was 18.  

Pretty small venue but a great way to get the night started.  Drinks are relatively cheap, bar tenders are nice.  Smoking area makes for great people watching and to take a breather from the squishy dance floor.  Usually little to no cover.  

Fun things always tend to happen at Q Bar, from girlfriends having accidents in the bathroom to dancing on the benches near the dance floor.
author: Andrew Christian C.

description:
Q-bar on Monday nights for no cover and $1 cocktails (one dollar! I know, right?!) and a happily mixed crowd. Gay boys, straight girls, even straight boys. It gets pretty crowded by 11pm, so be prepared for squeezing through snug spaces. If ya know what I mean. 

Not sure about the rest of the week but Mondays are pretty rad (speaking from the point of view of a straight girl, that is.)

Go... because sometimes you just have to dance, get sweaty, and get tipsy (with the help of magical $1 cocktails.)
author: Ashley M.

description: Every time Monday rolls around I wonder if I have the energy for Qbar and their 1 dollah drinks. It's very tempting to start the week with some dancing and stiff, cheap drinks; yet if you plan to drink more than one, I advise you come early (8-9ish) to easily get the bartender's attention and to enjoy your drinks sitting down. Things get crazy at Q-bar after 10. They take away the tables and padded booths to make room for more people and more dancing.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I came here for the first time after doing no pants on bart and muni with a few friends and our pantless selves were greatly welcomed. Good old school hip hop and strong drinks. I was a happy pantless camper. 

A smoking room and plenty of dance space too.

Thanks Q Bar for making my pantsless day the best!
author: Lauren S.

description:
UGH! I'm so torn between giving this 5 stars or 1 star.  

We'll start with why it should get five stars:
Love love love the ENERGY 92.7 - esque music that's playing.  I'm talking Britney remixes, Gaga remixes, dance party USA; just 100% awesome dance music.  I'm not even much of a dancer, but you can't help but grind it up at Q Bar.  The bartenders are hot (clearly gay), but not bitchy at all, which slightly surprised me.  They are super friendly, make strong drinks, and are fast.  I love all the black lights going on -  I couldn't stop looking around.  It definitely has a club feel, but there's  an area where you can chill out, sit down, take a break, etc.  **SMOKERS** - they have a complete separate area for smokers, kind of like at Vertigo.  

Why it should get 1 star:
$2 cover? What? Make it no cover or $5.  A $2 cover is just weird.  My main complaint about this bar? The rude DJ.  I go up to request a song as normal (David Guetta's Sexy Bitch), he doesn't see me, so I start waving my arms.  He ignores me while texting on his phone.  I finally yell, Hellllllo, and he annoying looks over at me and says "what do you want?"  I say I want to request a song.  He says no.  I say Why?  He says just because.  Fine, no need to be a dick about it.  He could've just answered me immediately and said something like "sorry hun, we don't take requests."  That would've been fine.  No need to be an asshole.  Don't take your sh*tty life out on me.  Thanks. 

ANYHOW - I will definitely be coming back here w/ all my gfs to get our dance on.  Patty, we should go for Wednesday night Lez night.
author: Jenny W.

description:
This is a happy place to be. Although the boys can get a little rowdy at times and dance on the stage while half naked-- something about this place just puts you in this 'happy' mood and you just feel really great.

It is a bit crowded-- and on Mondays when its $1 dollar drinks.. it gets super packed! But most definitely worth fighting your way to the bar to get your drank onnnn! 

Drinks are $1 on mondays and they are REAL mixed drinks-- not just beer. 

Most definitely reminds me of a european bar/club due its mixed crowd and house music.
author: Hanna K.

description:
Best bar in the Castro, IMO.  You can dance to a nice mix of pop and hip hop and don't have to listen to droning house music.  Drinks are good and strong - the Melon Martini is amazing and unique!  Best mix of people, too!  All ethnicities, sexes, ages and sexual orientations.  I'm a gay white middle-aged male, but get totally bored with the Castro's homogeneous (GWM) bar crowd that's usually all twinks, bears, leather or circuit queens, or old codgers (of which I will soon be one... of.)  ;-)

The minus one star is for how hot and crowded it gets and that, like in all bars, smokers monopolize the cool patio area.
author: Barney M.

description: First gay bar visit. Was a lot of fun and the outdoor/indoor patio smoking area was sweet! A bud light was like $2.50 I think on a Saturday night?
author: Samantha S.

description:
I have no time for seriousness when out with a group of friends. I am looking for zero attitude, fun people, dancing and fabulous music. I don't care if you are fat or skinny, gay or straight, blonde pale or chocolate with green hair... I want to boogie. 
And Q Bar has cute sweet bartenders. Check your coat, the place is small and gets super packed.
author: Helen K.

description: Came into the city for my long time friend's bachelorette party. After bar hopping we landed here. At the time there was no cover, which is always appreciated. The bar was pretty small, but the bartenders were friendly and eager to serve, which I always appreciate. But, it wasn't a particularly memorable experience.
author: Sheena M.

description:
Well fuck, if you're looking for a good time in CASTRO then Qbar is the best damn place to be. I've been here on Thursday and Friday nights but I personally recommend the music better on Friday's. My bestfriend introduced me to this place months ago and it's always a good time everytime I go.

Mixed crowds of people. Cheap drinks. Great bartenders. Great music. Stank ass bathrooms LMAO. Who the fuck thought it was a cute idea to put one stall in the females restrooms? I would have gave Qbar the whole 5 stars but I've had to squat on the toilet because someone puked on it before I went to use it. No bueno.

Oh, and the AC AND FANS USED TO WORK in that piece but for some reason someone thought it would be funny to turn off the air ventilation and throw a few smelly ass people who didnt wash their pits before coming out into such a small space. *Shakes Head*

BUT HEY! ASIDE FROM ALL THAT SHIT, I love this place!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Dre D.

description: This a review for a Wednesday night. So, Wednesday is ladies night, I didn't know. After being there for 20 min and staring at girls getting down to "get nasty" it finally dawned on me. Duh. The drinks I had were ok 16 bucks for 1kettle soda and 1 absolut migmlet . I like the covered patio were you can smoke.
author: Rick A.

description:
This is one of my favorite bars in the castro, my other favorite was bar on church but they're closed now. 
I came here a few weeks ago with some friends on thur night which was 2 for 1 well drinks night. There wasn't too many people when I got there but it does get crowded after a while and it doesn't help that this place is pretty small.
author: Stephanie L.

description: I came on sunday 31, 2011 around 3:30 pm...the reason I stooped at Q bar cause the happy hour 2x1 so i made my order just a simple fucking "cosmo" so the fucking bartender made just a glass!!! And I asked him, why only one? So he answer was cosmo is not included as happy hr...so I paid and then I asked the other bartender about this issue and he told me, we are serving cosmo as happy hour 2x1 , I was like wtf!!! So people please make sure what are you guys doing!!!! I hate this kind of shit!!! Stop cheating people !!!! Booooo for this bartenders full of shit! Qbar FUCK OFF!!!!
author: Almeida R.

description: I was there for a drink (Im embarrased to say). Rude service. Disgusting and dirty seating. Just awful. Garbage.
author: M F.

description: Decided to go here after it was recommended to me by a friend. My friends and I arrived there when the bartenders started to remove the chairs to make space on the dance floor. Drinks are $2 on Mondays . The place is pretty small but my friends and I still managed to have fun on the dance floor.
author: Erin A.

description:
It's official, I'm in love! In love with Q that is. It's so great, I just can't take it. $10 pitchers? Yes sir, may I have another? Oh and we did. They play the best mixes. Such a wide variety from 80's to current . I couldn't sit still. My booty was a shakin'. It's so easy to spend hours in here and not even realize it. 

I confess. I'm more comfortable in a gay bar knowing that I'm not going to get hit on by sleazy, dirty and annoying guys. I can just sit back and relax with my friends and drink my drink. 

The guys at Q were oh so mighty fine. Especially that bartender with the tats and piercings...oh my! Great eye candy.
author: Kelly M.

description:
This was my first REAL experience at a gay club/bar and it was AWESOME.

Went here for the first time 2 weeks ago on a Tuesday night. My friends told me it was CRACKIN on Tuesdays... but CRACKIN was an understatement. This place was OFF THE WALL crackin. I couldn't BELIEVE how many people came out that night.

--minus 1 star--
It's a really small place with a really small outdoor patio. Because there were so many people, it was HOT inside. I ended up taking off an article of clothing because it was SO HOT. o_0?!? haha. It was a bit too hot.... but that didn't stop me from dancing the night away in my stilettos (which was a mistake to wear. ugh)

No cover to get in and there are in's and out privileges. Drink specials for the evening is 1/2 of drinks for ladies.

Everyone there was very nice and it's all about FUN here. It's not all about trying to get attention and free drinks, like at straight clubs.

I would DEFINITELY come back here again very soon.
author: Heidi C.

description:
Qbar went above and beyond to help me throw a fundraising beer bust. They advised me on how to flyer, to bring jello shots (which brought in a lot of $), and the staff treated everyone fantastically. I can't say enough good things.
I've worked in bars in and around SF and this bar definitely invests in its community.
author: Laurinda J.

description:
There are more fun places and better 2:1 happy hours in the Castro than Q Bar. But the place is still a good time. The music selection varies on the night, and sometimes they play some pretty random stuff. Just like all the other bars in the neighborhood, they do know how to pour you a strong drink.

Check out Booty Call Wednesday here if you like to get fun portraits taken.

~A
author: Alex C.

description: This place never fails to move my arse. Hands down, the music is the best I've heard in the Castro. I come here to dance! I usually like to just move a little on the side watching people, drinking mah drinks. But here.. I'm on the dance floor. I really love the music! House, underground, techno, disco.. yesss! If you want to "hook up" may not have the best crowd for that. Best to go to Badlands or Lookout. (But music in those places are mainstream pop.. not what I prefer when I want to dance). So yeah.. I love this place!
author: Vol T.

description: If you are gay this place is probably the bomb. I came for the 2 for 1 drinks before 8:30 and to hang out with my gay friends. The drinks are pricier than other 2 for 1 drink places but this one will do it for 30 min. longer.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I went to the Q Bar on a wednesday with 2 guy friends. I didn't know for the happy hour which I believe is from 5pm-9pm, certain drinks are 2 for the price of 1! how cool is that? we arrived about 5:30ish and the bar wasn't that crowded but as the night went on, the place started to get crowded and the music louder. No big deal because by that time I believe we headed out to another bar in the area (Toad Hall). 

All in all, this place a great place to meet your friends after work for a great deal on the 2 for 1. and if you get there close to the beginning of happy hour, you'll find a table either inside or out in the patio area for the smokers which hey that was another plus! 

Oh and there was a drink that one of the bartenders make which we don't know the name of it but its a pink drink, VERY GOOD!
author: Tina M.

description:
Perfect place to relax and listen to great music while taking in the positive vibes that resonate off the crowd.

I love this place, this is my night home.  I tend to keep to myself and enjoy the music and drink with my friends.  Yes, we're straight and feel that this place is very friendly to everyone, as long as you got cash (cash only)

The bouncer is friendly and courteous.  Of course he is going to be an asshole sometimes, I mean he is a bouncer, but I never saw him once act rude towards a patron.  

Last time I went I watched "Casino Royale" with subs, while sipping my Tom Collins.  On the other hand, I have hit my head on the speaker while standing on the middle bench against the wall and dancing.  There should be a sign on the middle bench, 5'5 and under only.
author: Kailo R.

description: Both my phone and my friend's iPhones were stolen out of our *closed* purses that were on our persons the entire time we were in the bar.   We were not even drunk. There is a clever pickpocket in t his bar.  BEWARE.
author: Melissa S.

description:
Great beats, great treats, great meets.

Great beats: I can always count on Q-Bar for playing some good tracks to chill and dance to. During the day it's a lounge and at night the floor turns into a dance floor. It's a small space with a lot of character. Colorful walls, lights and plasma's bring light to the room and the outdoor covered patio area is the place where you can hang a light up.

Great treats: I'm a fan of their 2-for-1 Happy Hour drinks. One of the best deals on the strip for a cheap well drink. Whether your a gin and tonic or pineapple malibu guy, you can't beat the cheap drinks.

Great meets: There bartenders are friendly and the crowd is descent. You're sure to find a mix of locals and out-of-towners at Q-bar. 

Regardless of who you meet, you're sure to have a good time with a drink or two or when happy hour 4 or 6 (so long as it's an even number you're all good).
author: Andrew S.
