description: Came here on a Tuesday night with one of my friends. We weren't expecting to drink too much until we landed on happy hour. SO CHEAP! I loved it! The drinks were good too. Just right.. Music was good. Lights were pretty. Oh Q bar was so much fun! I would definitely come back.
author: Tiff C.

description: I've had an iphone stolen twice, two friends had their phones and wallet stolen. The place has a cool vibe, cheap drinks, but asshole bouncer who is completely uncooperative and useless basically. Yes I understand you're not accountable for my loss, but please assist me in finding it if I realize it was stolen 5 minutes ago. Don't be a dick, give me some service.
author: Naimah M.

description: It all began with a crazed urge to dance and be totally encapsulated by welcoming bodies. This is the place to do that. It doesn't matter if you are shy. After one of their reasonably priced drinks and seeing how free everyone else is (even on a Sun night!) you'll have no problems jumping right in! It is an easy place to make friends and some people even had glittered articles of clothing. Totally returning!!!
author: Bailey C.

description: Unfortunately, this message is about the unforgettable rude service my friends and I received this past Sat at the establishment! First of all my wife and I were visiting friends in San Fran and they took us to QBar last Sat. The drink specials were great and the space is nice but that's about the only nice comment I will say. At first we had to clear a table of empty drinks so we can sit. Then we had to grab some bar stools since there wasn't enough space but not even 10 minutes later the bartenders asked for the stools so they can put them away to clear up the dance floor but we were no where near the dance floor. We thought that was weird and rude. Then we see a woman in a wheel chair being kicked out. One minute she is on the dance floor enjoying women dance around her and the next I see her being escorted out. After that incident I companied my wife to the bathroom and the door was closed like normal bathrooms are suppose to be. So we go in and my wife uses the bathroom and I'm behind the door putting on make up where the mirror is at and some guy who works there slams the door open hitting me in the back with the door. I asked why did he small the door and he said the door needs to be kept open with an aggressive annoyed attitude. I told him he didn't need to be so rude. So he left but then my wife comes out of the bathroom and closes the door to piss him off but it back fires and he approaches me to tell be if I close the door again that I will have to leave. I told him that I never shut the bathroom door the first time or the second time. He didn't care only warned me that I was going to be escorted out for shutting HIS BATHROOM DOOR! I asked for the manager and he said he was the security. He literally got in my face in a confrontational position to the point he made me so mad.. Im not one to so upset but the way he made me feel got the best of me. I was so mad/sad that this was happening to me. I ended up pulling my friends from the dance floor and asking if we could leave. I don't think I've ever been treated so rudely and with so much anger coming from an employee. I'm definitely going to try and get a hold of management to let them know this should not be happening to anyone else, honestly think the gay boys that work there don't like gay girls.
author: Genevieve A.

description:
HAPPY HOUR! 2 for 1 drinks! The drinks are pretty cheap too!

2.50 WELL
3.50 CALL
3.00 SHOTS
3.00 DRAFT!

Seriously who could pass up on this offer! They do not skip out on the alcohol either.  We sat at the bar and its nice that they leave all the extra garnishes ( mint, cherries, limes, olives etc) out on the bar. They even have chex-mix that they serve in a cup to pick on. 

The bartenders are really friendly. The atomsphere during the day is chill. There are plenty of seats alongside the wall and in the patio area. The music is GREAT! They really play a mix of different genres. I could only imagine how this place is at night!
author: Geneve V.

description:
Same bar, new name:

http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-bar-on-castro-san-francisco#hrid:NWyep9vMLWkOL4y_GkK3PA/src:self

Oh, and for you alcoholics out there the Monday night drink special is $1 drinks vs. the old special of 80 cents. Now it will cost you an additional dollar to get pants shitting drunk.
author: Drue C.

description:
favorite gay bar/club in SF. people here are friendly, drinks are super cheap, and they party hard every night of the week, if you ever want to do some mid-week partying. but definitely don't miss booty call wednesday; it's the most fun you'll have on a wednesday in SF.

they also have a 2 for 1 happy hour until 9pm. if you're wondering "how is that different from just 50% off?" it means that everytime you order ONE drink, they give you TWO! recipe for a fun night :)

UPDATE: i did encounter some anti-straight bias on one recent trip, but that hasn't happened since, so i'm chalking it up to be an isolated incident.

and seriously, as others have said, if you want to party on a monday night like it's saturday night, there's no better place to go.
author: Mark A.

description: Really only come here for Bootie Call Wednesdays (http://www.yelp.com/biz/booty-call-wednesdays-san-francisco#hrid:cP7YHoNdozna0QCe2hSk3w), every other night is just done better elsewhere. For sure a good place to stop by or end up though.
author: Chris W.

description:
Here is an example of a Sunday Night....

People throwing bottles and dropping glasses everywhere.

The bathrooms are disgusting.

If you buy a drink and its accidently drop or spilt due to other patrons, EVERY OTHER CLUB would make you a new one on them. That is called customer service. This place replies "That isnt our fault, we are on camera".   Well i hope you get this on camera.

AND...the 10 people i brought definitely will not be returning.
author: Maht D.

description:
We stop by here every once in a while, its fun with a group of friends. The drinks are very ugh however. My friend ordered 2 shots of patron or some sort of similar drink and did not get ANY buzz at all. I got the mojito and it was like water with mint. Ugh. Overall the drinks to me were weak. 
Also the bouncer is a little rude sometimes... I Love love loved dancing on top of the elevated seating by the wall though. Which btw could get dangerous after you've had one too many too drink. I almost fell on that thing considering how narrow it is. BUT other than that feel free to bust that pussy in this bar/club!
author: Lorénz B.

description:
This place seems fun but it is definitely a bit too crowded on a Saturday night to breath, let alone dance, mingle, talk, or get a drink.

Also there are ridiculous amounts of gay boys, which is fun, but not when some are rude and just whipe their messes all over your shirt as they walk by. And yes it was on purpose.

Coat check is nice because you only want a t-shirt on it's so hot and humid in there. Also, I didn't have to pay cover because the bouncer was too drunk to care. I don't know if that's a good thing for them though. But even if I did, it was only $2 which is awesome.

Oh yeah and they didn't have any drink specials...?!
author: Xhris C.

description:
They KICK me out because I took my shirt off???

Don't come here! you will be having a NIGHTMARE ON CASTRO STREET!!!

I still ask my friends why they ask us to leave after seeing other guys topless.. and I don't want to sound cocky but I have a GREAT BODY!

I guess they change management.. BAD SERVICE! :-(
author: Aemar E.

description:
WOW. This place was really POPPING on Halloween Eve!!! 

We have heard of this place through a friend and we were glad we dropped by. It was like THE place to go in Castro!!! There was a small line outside when we were there but it didn't take any more than ten mins for us to get in. FYI...there was a $3 cover per person. The place is really tiny...you can really stand at one place and see everything in the entire bar. The music was good, they were mainly playing current hiphop music but also threw in the a couple classics here and there. There was only a couple of bartenders working, they were really busy but very efficient. The crowd was friendly. People were really there enjoying themselves, dancing, singing, having a good time. There was also a little side stage that ppl were dancing on. The vibe here was great. It's just the place to be to have a good time!!!
author: Winnie L.

description:
I've been here mostly for Ladies Night on Tuesdays. They have happy hour from 4 to 9pm and cocktails are 2 for 1. It's really easy to get trashed for cheap here. A word of advice, I would pay the little extra for a call drink as opposed to the well drink. It makes a difference that's worth it. 

As for the ladies scene, it was mostly coupled older lesbians. I doubt there was a queer lady within five years of my age. I would try Q-Bar for other nights, but I don't think it's worth it to pay a cover. 

Bonus points for the outdoor smoking patio area. It's really comfortable and it's a great place to socialise. There is a door from the inside leading to it that closes, so it doesn't get too cold or windy. It's probably the best thing about this place.
author: Dena R.

description:
This is a great bar, but you've got to go at the right time to get the full experience. I worked in the SoMa at a seasonal job and found myself hitting the Castro to "taste the rainbow" again after work. I hadn't been there since 2009 and felt it was time to reacqauint myself with the gay culture I had grown up with.

We used to go to this bar all the time. So I knew what I was getting into. But times change and people change. So I went here and found an empty seat next to what would be described an attractive blonde guy and a muscular latin gay man.

"YOU'RE SOOOOOOO HOT" he said to me. I then said, "Really?" and he said, "Oh, you are so sexy." Him and I talked.. Then eventually his ex b/f came over and began talking with us. The blonde began to flirt more and I straight up asked him, "Is this gonna end with me at your apartment in bed?".  It was awkward, but I didn't understand why he kept flirting with me.

The bar here is nice. It's definitely a GAY bar. You won't think the passable straight crowd of Moby Dick when you go here. The atmosphere is colorful, they have great bars, and lots of different colors. The bartenders are hot and friendly. You tend to see a lot of feminine gay boys, twinks, fruitflies. and fire hazards here. It's just the crowd it attracts.

I like this bar. But I have to go on a Thursday after work to fully enjoy it. Otherwise, it's empty. Even when I went to a comic signing on a Saturday night. There wasn't much of a crowd here. I go to bars to socialize and lots of different people mean a better experience.
author: Lana P.

description:
One star because they don't give a rat's ass about you.

Good music, but have you tried to get a drink, check a coat, get the same service you do from anywhere else, deal with their cover-monkey money-taker, or be treated nicely in any way? Not gonna happen.

I was kicked out for my second time tonight(both on Wednesdays). In each case the bouncer was baffled by why the bouncer/money-taker had requested I be kicked out.

The first night was after asking the money taking dude(being nice with this phrase) for a deal with 15+ people. He said "I see you (sensored-bit) all night. Ask me again and I will kick you out." To which I replied "Don't be sour, what's wrong with a dollar off if I bring FIFTEEN people here on an off night?" Kicked out.

Tonight I asked for water from the bartender, who seemed very pissed. Maybe a misread of his emotion on my part, but I said "Hey, you should ask your manager to have water available for people to self-serve, that way you don't have to pour it for everyone." Kicked out again.

All in all, I think we (you and I and everyone) will keep going there. I mean, as a masochist, I love having bartenders rape me on the regular.
author: Kelly J.

description:
One thing you must know about me. Not only do I love giving out hugs, I love to dance. You know the kind of dance where you can just move and shake your hips and jump around and have a good time. It's that kind of drunken-dance in your room in your underwear-free spirit kind of dance. And here I feel just like that when I dance with my boys here.

After my not-so-exciting experience at the cafe I wasn't too sure about trying Q-Bar. I was wrong. 

Bartender that night made some mean kamikaze's but my margarita was no joke just straight up tequila. Which is fine by me it just was not a margarita. 

Ran into friends and friends of friends. Danced to some amazing mix of Gaga and shared tons of laughs. Not bad Q Bar. Not bad.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Totally COOL place!

+cool music
+tasty drinks
+friendly staff
+awesome atmospere
+great crowd!

NO COMPAINTS)
author: Lerka J.

description:
Always a pretty hoppin vibe!

I used to come on Lesbian Night Tuesdays when my friend was DJing here, but lately, the crowd has gotten younger and younger... college student age, perhaps? But if that's what you're looking for, this is the place for it!

The only time I have been unsatisfied was during Ladies Night, when the Lesbian bartender told me she would only serve one drink to my gay brother who never comes into town! :( For a place I like to take people to, I was kind of disappointed. Oh, and by all the straight people coming to the gay spots because its all-of-a-sudden cool to hang with the gays... ? Naw, I guess they can't help it. 

Overall, though, when friends come into town, this is one of the places I like to take them to. Usually pretty good dance music and decent drinks.
author: Gina H.

description:
Let's be honest, if you're hangin out at a place like Q Bar, you're not gonna leave sober.  I've been here for dancing, and it was ok.  The space is so small and narrow.  Personally, I like to move around and not be constantly bumping into someone (worse when you're walking around with drinks).
However, their happy hour is a-maz-ing.  2-for-1 from open to 9pm? Why doesn't EVERYONE meet here after work??  You can do some real damage, in a very short amount of time, and still leave with a full wallet.  
Great place to take visiting friends/family...if you want to give them that special Castro experience :)
author: CJ C.

description:
Unfortunate new name but all the things I loved about the old BOC are still there - the great bartenders and BOOTY CALL.

The crowd is still a bit intimidating and rowdy on the weekends but Wednesday night is super fun. They had Lawrence Petty DJing last week and I hope they make him a resident. He played some amazing music - the perfect balance between gotta get up and move and bob my head while I sip my cocktail...

The men to boys ratio was a little weak for me but my friends are chicken hawks so they were in heaven.
author: Quartknee K.

description:
For cheap drinks after a long day in the office during the work week, Q Bar is the answer. Themed days accompany the speedy service and affordable drinks. The dance floor is pretty much non-existent, but when the atmosphere has a good vibe, people make a dance floor happen (cramped up, on the side wall benches, on the bar top counters, in the bathrooms ... haha). The patio is a nice little area, despite the small space. All in all, a great bar on the Castro ... just a bit cramped and sweaty at times. 

Best deal? 2 for 1s!!!
author: Mike N.

description: I always have a great time at QBar. Strong drinks, great music, and a friendly crowd. Much bettercrowd than other places in the castro.
author: Mark S.

description:
Not bad, not bad...

Still carries the vibe of BOC, but with a WHOLE new spirit.

The new decor is great, it brings the vibe of the Redwood Room at the Clift, but with a homo touch.

Last experience?

I was feeling a little hungover, maybe a little too drunk for the past few days. And for that I always settle for a Cucumber Martini ... and here, their Q Cumber was no different.

A bite, but still refreshing with the mint and cucumber it was good. The bartender, however didn't know what it was and had to browse the menu.

UH... I'll forgive that one.
author: Kim D.

description: I love this place! I've always had a good time and they play fun upbeat music. People are friendly....they might seem a little stand-offish at first, but go to the smoking section and strike up a conversation and people are super friendly! The bar tenders mix strong drinks and have excellent service!! Small but fun and a must in castro!!
author: Dana W.

description:
This place is the best bar on Castro Street.  There is an incredibly diverse vibe.  While any night is fun (with great music, [relatively] cheap drinks, and a full house), Monday is the night to head over to Q Bar.  Their $1 well drink Monday night deal is unbeatable, and it draws a fun, energetic crowd.

I would recommend this bar to anyone who spends time in the Castro--it is an absolute gem.
author: Matthew W.

description:
Yay for 2 for 1 drinks!  Q bar is a fun, high energy place to stop on a bar hopping tour or just for whenever. The staff is quick and the dress and feel is casual. 

Good times!
author: Tysen C.

description: Unfortunately, this message is about the unforgettable rude service my friends and I received this past Sat at the establishment! First of all my wife and I were visiting friends in San Fran and they took us to QBar last Sat. The drink specials were great and the space is nice but that's about the only nice comment I will say. At first we had to clear a table of empty drinks so we can sit. Then we had to grab some bar stools since there wasn't enough space but not even 10 minutes later the bartenders asked for the stools so they can put them away to clear up the dance floor but we were no where near the dance floor. We thought that was weird and rude. Then we see a woman in a wheel chair being kicked out. One minute she is on the dance floor enjoying women dance around her and the next I see her being escorted out. After that incident I companied my wife to the bathroom and the door was closed like normal bathrooms are suppose to be. So we go in and my wife uses the bathroom and I'm behind the door putting on make up where the mirror is at and some guy who works there slams the door open hitting me in the back with the door. I asked why did he small the door and he said the door needs to be kept open with an aggressive annoyed attitude. I told him he didn't need to be so rude. So he left but then my wife comes out of the bathroom and closes the door to piss him off but it back fires and he approaches me to tell be if I close the door again that I will have to leave. I told him that I never shut the bathroom door the first time or the second time. He didn't care only warned me that I was going to be escorted out for shutting HIS BATHROOM DOOR! I asked for the manager and he said he was the security. He literally got in my face in a confrontational position to the point he made me so mad that I started to cry. I don't cry but the way he made me feel got the best of me. I was so mad/sad that this was happening to me. I ended up pulling my friends from the dance floor and asking if we could leave. I don't think I've ever been treated so rudely and with so much anger coming from an employee. I'm definitely going to try and get a hold of management to let them know this should not be happening to anyone else!
author: Stephon B.

description:
Overall a really great first bar experience!
-The bouncer was very nice
-Served immediately by the bartender who also helped me pick out a drink
-Fun 90s music on a Thursday night with the music videos playing too!
author: lydia b.

description:
Cheap drinks for the ladies on Tuesdays,
always, always crowded,
a small and cute dance floor, (plus the occasional seats that the ladies got up on),
what more can you ask for? 
Qbar makes my Tuesdays worth looking forward to.
Plus, NO COVER!
author: Miss C.

description: I went tonight because DJ Jay R was spinning.  He made a nice and smooth mix.  Crowd was having fun.
author: Cynthia B.

description: Went on a Wednesday. Im confused by this place...they charge a cover $4 and the drag queens come out and stand with customers were sitting, but no show. They just all go-go dance. GIRL BETTER WORK IT HARDER haha! This bar was alright, but if you wanna dance in a better environment hit up badlands. OH but the drinks are cheap HAYYYY! $2.50 in San Fran might be unheard of! Tuesday is lesbo night and it was packed.
author: Samantha N.

description:
For a "gay bar" there were a lot of straight people here, but whatever.  Supposedly people go to bars to meet people, but as far as I could see everyone was hanging out in the groups they came with--whatever to that, too.  I visited on a Thursday night and it wasn't that crowded, but from the other reviews it sounds like Saturdays get crazy busy.

The only thing that matters as far as I'm concerned is that I met my new favorite beer here--Longboard Lager.  WOW.  It just keeps going, and the flavor is perfectly balanced between sweet and bitter (in my opinion).  On top of how awesome it tastes, it was a great deal.  Q Bar also has a great Happy Hour going.  Go for Happy Hour, ride the Longboard, you'll love it.
author: Jin D.

description:
My friends and I came on a Tuesday night, and the cover was only $2 which was great.  Drinks were reasonably priced.  The music was great; it was like top 40's pop dance stuff.  The variety of girls there was great.  As an out-of-towner, it was clear that most people come pretty regularly, but everyone was nice and willing to talk.  The coat check guy was very friendly!  There's not really a dress code; just come as you are.  There's a smoking room as well.  

My only complaint is that they let way too many people in, because as the night went on, it got extraordinarily hot, and there wasn't really enough room to dance comfortably.
author: Rona H.

description: So Q Bar is the new iteration of the old Bar on Castro. They were closed for a while, and re-opened... and... um... it's the Bar on Castro with a latex banner out front that says Q Bar. Nothing's different. Oh, except that they removed the bench seating in the back, which was the coolest thing about the Bar on Castro. And they did away with $10 all-you-can-drink Happy Hour Sundays. Um... boo...
author: Sean B.

description:
"Meet the new bar, same as the old bar" 
Q Bar is pretty much the identical twin of its predecessor,
the Bar on Castro... and by identical twin, I mean, they both
were born in a dumpster addicted to crack... but unfortunately, 
this baby is still looking to be saved from its dumpster stew

Well drinks were only $3 bc of its opening promotion...
and there was no cover charge... so if you're looking to get 
sloshed on a budget, this is the place to be

The music was good...  but the crowd has changed 
and most likely has atrophied a bit due to BOC's move...
It's also one of the few remaining bars with a designated 
smoking area... although I think they should forsake the ashtrays
who hang out in that area and open it up to make the bar less cramped..

it's definitely a bar looking for an identity...  maybe someday
we can wean it off of crack and it will  find its potential
author: Ryan K.

description:
Of all my years of DJing in the Castro, hands down, I have to say Q-Bar is the best club/bar in the Castro by far.
The vibe is amazing, the people are stylish, and the cocktails are original.
It's very crowded and very packed and that's the way it should be.
Best advice I recommend is find your bartender, stay within his vicinity, clear of the middle of the club and you should have no problem hanging out with your friends.
Q-Bar is doing it's job if it's that busy. It screams San Francisco and doesn't try and be LA or Vegas at any point. Locals, music lovers, and party goers know that.

There are a lot of straight people that party at Q-Bar. You have the gay sponsors to thank for that. Majority of the straights that visit the Castro know that Q-Bar and their goers are cool, hip, and they leave with a positive attitude.
Seven nights a week, Q-Bar always has something different going on. Pick the night that suits you best and you'll have a blast. See you there!
author: Jay-R N.

description: The QBar is the place to be at! If you want hot men, hot music, cheap drinks and hot asian men you gotta hit QBAR! The dj is like really really hot too
author: Lechuga C.

description:
So I've been here several times now and has never disappointed! QBar is THE PLACE to be on Tues night if you're a gay girl who loves to dance! Ok, so one night it got a little crazy when this girl was upset from almost being hit by this stupid drunk guy and she broke the window in the smoking area, but that is the exception... honestly, before that happened, I still had a blast that night.

So if I could complain about one thing, it would be that they allow TOO MANY people in. A friend of mine told me they've already been cited twice for overcapacity. It's actually not the funnest in the world to constantly be bumped into when you're trying to dance, especially when those people aren't dancing and are just trying to get across the room, but I digress. Overall, it is always a good time here on tues! You will not be disappointed!
author: Shannon S.

description:
This place is small, and packed, and the line to the bathroom is long! But it's a fun place with some pretty nice people.

Drinks are good and cheap on Monday/Tuesday.
author: Brie P.

description: I went here on a Sunday. The dj played weird music and the place was embarrassingly empty. Like I could do several roundhouse kicks and not hit anyone. Frankly I was bored here. Even the gogo dancers had a glazed over look of boredom that you usually only see in hipsters. The great thing about the Castro is that if one bar sucks, just move onto the next one.
author: k h.

description:
I'm a single, straight man living in the city... and I love Q Bar. I've only been on $1 Tuesdays. Unlike most dollar deals in San Francisco, this place isn't just Olympia, Hamm's, and High Life. Well drinks are only a buck here on Tuesdays.

Add that to the fact that if you like electronic music, this place will be rocking your favorite tunes. I came here for the first time on friend's birthday, and this is what I had to say to the birthday boy:

"Happy birthday, Eric! I freakin' love this place. The drinks are cheap, there's a smoking room, everyone is super friendly, and I know all the words to every song!!!"
author: Daley T.

description: me and friend were just looking for a good time; getting laid wasnt an option because of our housing arrangement but i had a blast and this place was really diverse. at most clubs i've been to, everyones just trying to be cool, but everyone was having a fun time. the music was indie house and they play music videos on all the walls except for the wall housing 2 male gogo dancers (a first for me..). anyways, i highly recommend this club and will probably be back. they are cash only (no card) but you can get a bud light for $4 and corona for $4.50
author: Cara D.

description: Small dance floor, crowded at high tide. Too much house music on a Friday night. Fun with a group.
author: Inigo M.

description:
Dollar nights. A mess.

Music is fun, crowd a little too hipster for me, but dollar drinks makes up for it.

Don't go to the lady bartender. Her drinks are weak.
author: Rocky K.

description: ... too small of a place, one bathroom, mostly boys, but great ass music! Just nowhere to stand/dance/chill. Also took forever at the bar.
author: JIBBY B.

description: We went on a Tuesday after having dinner in the Castro. We were able to hold a nice conversation and enjoyed people watching but there was no real dancing/clubby feel. We attempted to dance for a bit were given a few weird looks. I would say this a chill place to hang out with a group of people.
author: Lidia Z.

description:
This is my favorite place to dance the night away. Here you will find amazingly hot guys and amazingly hot girls.. and boy can they dance.
I love going here with my girlfriend and dancing on the dance floor.

The only bad side to this place is the small space. It's jammed packed on the busy nights. (Don't wear  expensive shoes because they will get stepped on)

You'll find the nicest gay boys at this place. I have been kissed by beautiful gay men and hit on by the girls.

Drink the Adios Motherfucker. It'll get you done once you have three or so of those.


EDIT:
The crowd that gathers at this bar is the type that'll give you a bottle of water should you get so wasted that you can't quite walk .. I know this from a drunken night of 4 jager bombs, 2 adios motherfuckers, 1 rum and coke, and 1 of their colorful cocktails (this was after all you can drink beer at the Mixx during happy hour (another great place)). This is a much better vibe than The Cafe as the people at The Cafe will just laugh and point at you.
author: Sharelle W.

description: When I first moved to the city this was my second bar I went to. Q bar quickly became my favorite bar. My new friends and I would come here every week. Chris and Big Mike the two bouncers are always down for a good talk and are really nice and may I say too cute and huggable. The drinks aren't to pricey and the dance floor is always ready. BUT BE AWARE this place is small and gets full WAY TOO fast. Look in from the outside one can see if it's a good night. A tell tell sign if it's a good night is if in the smoking area there is a lot of people. I will always be a fan of Q bar it was my first bar my new friends in San Francisco got to know one another.
author: Garrett M.

description: Love it. Great vibe. Only thing that sucks is they only take cash. That's kinda annoying. But other than that really fun place.
author: Anna C.

description:
Packed. Waited in line for the bathroom for at least 10 minutes.
There's a nice area for smoking that is of decent size. Had fun and danced which I never do. I'd go back on a not so busy night.
author: Jacob K.

description:
I don't know what to say about Q Bar. I've had the BEST and the WORST nights at Q Bar so it's really hard for me to rate it. I usually go on ladies night when the drinks are half off. This is probably my favorite place to go on a random weeknight because it always feels like its the weekend. That may or may not be a good thing though if you know what I mean. The line to get in gets long but the line to get a drink gets even longer. If your like me and you like to drink, expect at least 40 mins total waiting in line for drinks and turns at the bathroom. Drinks are well mixed and cheap but sometimes I don't even think its worth it to wait in line for. 

Q Bar is like a drug, you want to quit but your just so addicted.
author: emily g.

description: This is my Tuesday party.  Every Tuesday they do a ladies night called 13 licks... greatest party ever.  Really cheap drinks, really good music, and really hot girls.  I love going there to get buzzed and dance for a couple hours. One of the bartenders, Amy, also bar tends dollar margaritas at the Lex on Fridays. They also have a indoor smoking room in the front, which can get a little smokey, but good for conversation and cooling off from dancing.  I would love to go again and meet another cute girl straight out of Marines training... yummy...
author: Meara G.

description:
I went here twice while in San Fran... I don't know why. It seemed like everyone was always there. This place was horrible. 

1. It's small and crowded.
2. The DJ was horrible. BOTH times. I can't remember the last time I heard such lousy music. He was soooo bad. WTF was he playing anyways? 
3. Some kids were all cracked out and ended up spilling their drinks all over my jacket. Thanks guys
4. Cash only. Whats with SF and cash only bars? I lose that shit too easily.
5. Sometimes they actually charge a cover. 

The bartender was very nice but the crowd sucked, the DJ sucked, and the B.O. was ridin high.
author: Tom B.

description:
3 things:
1) this is my first Yelp review ever
2) this was my first visit to Q Bar ever
3) this was the first time I had something stolen from me ever

I really enjoyed the space, the music, the crowd. I guess this review isn't about any of that or the staff. I don't know how often people have there things stolen from here, but since it was my first visit there.. it makes me think all the time? I was pretty much watching my bag the whole time too. I had put my bag on one of those tables that people were dancing on, and had friends' jackets on top of it.. and we were dancing right in front of it.. guarding it. But when we were leaving for the night.. right when I grabbed my bag, I noticed that the front zipper was open.. and my ipod was gone. So my one star review is for that. I'm just upset that I don't feel safe going back here anymore. The thief was really good! I was never more than 3 feet from my bag! And it was in a corner!

Hm, I guess since this is a Yelp review, I should say something about the actual place and not just the thief huh? 
Got it: Q Bar attracts good thieves.

So, whenever someone asks me about or references Q Bar, I'll respond with, "oh yea, that's where I had something stolen from me for the first time ever." Or whenever someone asks me about my first Yelp review, I'll respond with, "oh yea, Q Bar. I wrote that review because I had something stolen from me for the first time ever there." You get the point. Bitter, disillusioned, and disappointed, I am.
author: Marjorie H.

description: I love the music and the smoking patio that sits right inside the front of the club.  Cute spot to socialize.
author: James V.

description: This place makes any Chip and Dale place to shame! These guys here are BADBOYS or BADASS BADBOYS with a band and yes there GAY! The place is small but It's AWESOME!!!
author: EdwardF A.

description:
I think, perhaps, I burned myself out in my early(earlier) twenties.  I mean, going out 7 nights a week for 5 years does take a toll after a while.  This, paired with my new recession behavior (I hide the cash in my mattress) means that I don't go out as much as I used to.  Call it old age, perhaps I'm just seasoned (or burnt), or just tired of things gay gay gay.

I used to live a few blocks from BOC and would go mostly because of the convince factor.  A dance company I was a part of had a short lived gig go-go dancing there (Imagine me dressed up like a little native boy shirtless in a loin cloth and a big feathered headdress).  After a long enough time I started to get friendly with some of the bartenders.  The Wednesday night Booty Call party ended up taking a place as my favorite night out.  If you haven't been, there's a weekly photo set done in the back room where you can get your picture taken.  The host, Juanita More, is one of my favorite people.  Ever.

I went to the opening of Q bar last week.  Noticeable changes included the color switch from red to blue, the removal of the optical illusion mirror wall behind the bar that drove me nuts, the back seating gutted out, and those TERRIBLE tabled hung from poles that every drunk idiot tried to dance on (I'm still shocked that on one ever died).  Other than that, it's the same bar, the same bartenders, and the same Juanita.

I'd still go here before I'd go to the sadlands.
author: Mister G.

description: Good music, fun sweaty people dancing it up, no cover  - loved it!
author: Em L.

description: i love going here. it is cash only. pretty small spot. very cute couples. good music. terrible bathrooms.
author: Kristine D.

description: The interior has definitely improved but I definitely miss the Bar on Castro that is now the Bar on Church. I think it's all a matter of getting used to. All this shifting has yet to settle in my mind but I have yet to grow accustomed to the name change alone. It still gets awfully crowded I love how Lady's Night at Q Bar still has many of the cute gay boys showing off their dance moves! They do play wicked music and its great still but damn I can't get past how its changed.  Overall, it's still a sweet spot in one of the greatest neighborhoods in San Francisco. Yay for Q Bar!
author: Dorothy S.

description:
Ugh, fine!  I'll admit it.  I'm slowly warming to this place.

I don't know if it has to do with the completed renovations, or what (seriously, the new color scheme is a lot less "manic panic" than it used to be), but I kinda dig it....

I've only really ever been during the middle of the week, when its not terribly busy, so I can only speak to that crowd...but yeah, you got me, Q Bar!

Though, maybe its just than when you hold this place up against the "New" BOCs, Triggers, Badlands and Toad Halls of the world, its luster just starts to shine a little brighter?  I guess that I don't have such a problem with that.
author: Jesse J.

description:
so close yet so far.. to the full 5
the place is tiny and bc it gets packed all that body heat is no good.. even with all the fans going on..

I've only been dancing in the castro twice and both times have been at q bar.. the plan was supposed to go dancing downtown but after deciding waiting in long lines is just a waste of time we decided to pick up my friend's friend in the castro and ended up here..i have to stay that both times i've gone have been such a blast. no/cheap cover + cheap drinks + great music =  a good, fun night. plus where else can i go clubbing and get compliments about my hair and outfit from a guy that has no urge to grind on me?! no where!
author: Raquel T.

description:
The only two things that keep this establishment 2 stars away from being undeniably fantastic are:

-The words 'ONE' and 'STANK' preceding the word 'bathroom' [Notice no plural as in one stall in the Womens.. err, Woman room]
-Overcrowding [Don't wear anything nice from the ankle down, your feet and your *clean* shoes will hate you]

Other than that you're good to go.. great music / djs with drink specials to boot. Tuesdays though, are where its at.
author: Av A.

description: Tuesday night ladies night? Pretty freakin packed once 11 hit. Seems to be more of 27+ age range so i felt kinda young but i still had a good time the DJ was pretty freakin awesome and the bartenders were very attentive =]
author: Lisa L.

description: The bar looks nice. It has a very small, sometimes non existent dance floor. The DJs play good and different music, unlike what you would hear at any of the other clubs and that is refreshing. The people Qbar attracts include some of the same guys you see at any of the other bars but theres also a lot of different people that seem to go here. The bathrooms always seem clean. The bar itself gets pretty full. There is some seating but most of the people are just standing around, often times where the dance floor is supposed to be.
author: L. A.

description: A little small but cheap strong drinks and they have the best house music on Friday nights. Love this place!
author: Carrie C.

description: Is SAD to say this... But I want my girl- friends to know the Castro a bit better so I planned to take them to different clubs so " OUR FIRST STOP"  Q bar... I showed my ID ( city ID)  to the the guy at  front and he came saying that my ID is Fake. In  top of that he said that you can get an ID like that anywhere or any store!! I ask him iv the can call his manage, he said he will say the same. Very disappointed!! I will never go back to that place.
author: Sady M.

description: SMOKING ROOM!!!! That's all i have to say. Typical gay club with loud music and a lot of eye candy. Cheap drinks too so you can't go wrong.
author: Kapena C.

description: Q Bar is always a must when I visit SF. They have amazing drink specials if you get there before 9. 2 for 1! We literally paid $6 for two drinks. The bartenders are always super friendly too. Music is usually pretty decent but not as good as Badlands in my opinion. It is definitely small, but isn't every club in SF? All in all my favorite bar in the Castro.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Love the indoor/ outdoor patio. Really enjoy the beats, atmosphere, and drinks are as strong as me ;) For being in the Row, it's decently mixed with some lesbians sprinkled in on some nights.
author: Lynn R.

description:
This bar was o.k. The $3 cover charge wasnt bad. But it was horribly cramped inside once it started picking up. Its even a hassle just to get to the restroom. I really didn't like that.

The music was good. When I came to SF I expected to hear lots of good electronic dance music. This place delivered! I WANTED SO BADLY TO DANCE. But there was no room. whatsoever. Could barely manage a simple side 2 side step. It bugged the crap out of me. Very hot!!!

Drinks were blah. I ordered a Vodka n Redbull and barely tasted the Vodka. 

I would go back for the music, nothing more.
author: Thomas M.

description:
Some Q Bar lowdown:
* Very affordable: vodka tonic ($5), Guinness ($6), Cover $4 per person    
* Music: Mash Ups, Top 40, Lady Gaga
* Funnest Nite: Probably "Booty Call Wednesday" (Tuesday is Ladies' Nite)
* Crowd when we went Friday: College students or recent grads (damn, I feel old), mixed crowd of straights & gays
* Bartenders are awesome & cute.
* Love the open air patio where people can kick it, socialize & drink when their favorite song isn't playing (you know, songs that make you whine, "that's mah jaaammm.") 
* No dress code, but jeans & chucks are pretty much the uniform
* Co-ed bathroom w/ one stall & one urinal in the same room--makes for a very interesting end of the night when I'm washing my hands next to a boy peeing.
* Funniest story involving this bar (from back in the day): involves a very inebriated, cute gay boy pushing my friend & screaming, "You think you're too good for me! You think you're all that!" completely out of the blue when we weren't doing anything to warrant the shrieking at all!
author: Fancypants X.

description: Only place in the castro with visuals, music, and an indoor smoking lounge.  play nice boys.  the entire place is wired, for what comes next.
author: Chris C.

description: Very cute tiny little bar on Castro St, kinda reminded me of NYC G Lounge! Very good dance music, not enough space to dance though.
author: Will P.

description: Am I the only one who isn't on the Q Bar bandwagon? I've only been here on Tuesday nights. I appreciate the cheap drinks. However, every time I come here, I feel like a sardine in a can. I'm not sure if it's just that packed or if the venue is just too small. If you want stiff-cheap drinks, decent music, and a packed dance floor then this is the place for you. Just get ready to sweat and get sweated on!
author: Claire M.

description: My review is kind of biased because I'm not down for clubbing and was dragged there by friends. If you like to be in a really loud place that plays remixes of top 40s, with people sweating and grinding on you, and dumping shots down your throat, then go for it. As for me? Never again.
author: Sabrina K.

description:
I'm not always a fan of change and the same applies here. Going through a remodeling, the staff was split in half, its dirty and the music is still just okay.

Bartenders are still great!
author: Art A.

description: Fun place whether your with a big group on a busy weekend or on a chill weekday evening. Staff is sweet and prices are reasonable.
author: Jesse M.

description: Tonight I'm not takin' no calls 'cuz I'll be dancin'
author: Faffy L.

description:
Love the face-lift. I definitely prefer blue lighting to red lighting, it's just more pleasant to be in.

Can't wait for the new nights now that they have their entertainment license. QBar will blow Bar on Church away, although I'm not sure if BOC can be any farther away than it already is from the rest of Castro....

Dana, you rock.

PS. If Dana asks you "What do you think?" referring to the bar's new looks, don't answer "Jack and Coke."
author: Jeremy V.

description: I can't really comment much on Q Bar because it was mostly a blur. One hot drunken blur. This was my first time in Castro and I wanted to parade around every gay bar in the area but somehow we strolled in here and never left until the place shut us out! The drink prices were reasonable but the music here was mostly techno-ish which isn't my fave but I guess I was drunk enough to dance through it. The crowd was a little older, the bathroom (only one stall for the ladies) was gross and out of toilet paper before midnight (really people really?!) and the dance area was really small. Regardless I was able to party like a rock star so it couldn't have been all that bad!
author: Ariza S.

description: Had the most fun here but I'll stick to weho any day
author: Christine H.

description: Been here a few times, last was on a Monday and there were DOLLAR drinks and a savage dance party. Great DJ's, great bartenders, awesome crowd!
author: Matt F.

description: Let's just say, that $1 Drink Mondays are the shit. It's crazy inside, and packed. Completely worth it. I honestly don't remember much, BUT what I do remember is that there was a line, that did move fairly quickly. Didn't wait for more than 5 minutes, if that. It wasn't difficult to make it to the bar either, for a packed venue. The bartenders pump out those drinks like gas. The music is cool, and the vibe is right.
author: Scylis A.

description: I was on vacation and decided to party it up on Castro. I am an LA fruit fly and usually bar hop in West Hollywood. Drinks in Frisco are sooooo much cheaper. Went on Tuesday (ladies night) it was ok. Female bartenders were quick and awesome. Then went back on Wednesday (boys night) and the male bar tenders were jerks. Waited FOREVER just to order. I ordered my usual, Ginger ale and belvedere, and he charged me $9. The night before I paid $7 for the same drink. My friend ordered the same exact drink from the same bartender and only got charged $7. I was discriminated against for being a female and he's probably pocketing that extra money. I've NEVER EVER had that happen to me. I will never go there again. Also they refused to sell my friend that doesnt drink, a Ginger beer. Their excuse was that they could only mix it with liquor. Ridiculous. They couldn't even pour some in a cup for him. I rather go to 440 where everyone was super nice and didn't over charge me for being the only female at the bar.
author: Liseth A.

description:
be warned: this review is from someone who got super drunk from Q BAR. i'm just saying...

I would definitely say that you would come here with a group... Q BAR can be trendy but if you're up for debauchery and poppin music, then go for it. i'm not sure if i would love to go here everytime, but if you're in dire of pure debauchery and drunken nights, i say that this is the place. i got out drunk and having a stranger to tag along. whatever.

cheap drinks and interesting crowd, that's what Q BAR is. gotta try mondays and wednesdays here, since that's their famous nights.
author: Marc K.

description: Love it.  SF staple.  Great environment and patio.
author: Jenni N.

description: recently went here for a little bit. After dinner and already a little buzzed, it seemed great. Good music, pretty bar, friendly atmosphere, skinny go go boys who cant dance. Cheap drinks and loud music to shake your booty to. It was fun!
author: Matt P.

description: Noisy neon space on the inside for dancing and cruising, covered outdoor space in front for chatting and smoking cigarettes. Mostly male crowd but not a meat market feeling, at least not at 9pm on a Thursday. The inside space seems too small to be good for dancing but too loud and chairless to be good for anything else, so I can't see myself returning here except to sit outside and peer out onto Castro street.
author: Mandy H.

description: Cheap drinks, great 90's music and my favorite gaysian birthday boy made a dull Thursday pretty fabulous.
author: Seong P.

description: Best Happy hour in the castro; there is a smoking area and the people are awesome!  Oh, and Monday nights are off the hook; $1 drinks all night!
author: Matt L.

description: Qbar was my least favorite place to visit in Castro. Now with much improvements its pretty good. The music really sucks if your a Hip Hop girl like myself though. However If you like house it seems that the crowd really loves the music so it must be pretty good. I love how they let you dance on the poles. Thats how you treat your guests . The drinks are absolutely perfect. Strong and Cheap. This place is definetly a check out place especially opn $1 mondays...The doormen are super hot and worth paying a $3 cover
author: Gina S.

description: One of my favorite bars EVER! I always have a blast with my homies when I come here. They're are never skimpy with the alcohol and the crowdiness doesn't seem to bug me. I used to come here more when it was The Bar but whatever, it's still one of my bars of choice :)
author: April S.

description: I have to admit this is one of the only bars in the Castro that my partner & I enjoy. We had a great time this past weekend! We met some of the most unaffected people, which was so refreshing. Genuinely nice looking and friendly to boot, that never happens, and we have gone a few times, so I don't think it is just a fluke. Love those two for one specials. The interior design is so much better than it's last incarnation as The Bar on Castro. I really prefer the blue lighting to that horrific red that makes everyone look as if they just stepped out of the Red Robin! Our bartender Steven was the best. He was so attentive, and gave us some recommendations for restaurants that he enjoyed, always kept our drinks full, even when it got busy. Truly, one of the best experiences that we have had in the Castro. Thanks, Steven.
author: Anthony K.

description:
im strait but ive been here so many times.
drinks are cheap, music is good and the crowd is .... fun.
castro tends to scare away some, i embrace the funness!
author: Ryan L.

description: I went to SF for the first time beging of the year. I asked around some of my friend about where to go and not to mention i was going to be there mon-wends.I was walking on castro when I saw the bar it was pretty packed and I heard some house music so i went it. it was great good crowd great music.
author: Lernik G.

description:
Nice crowd for a random Wednesday night.  Good music too.  

Minus 1 star for $3 cover on a Wednesday night
Plus 1 star for the photos in the back, last night was galactic themed :)
author: Olivia T.

description:
OK so the Bar on Castro closed down for a little bit, and it was supposed to be a grand opening of a brand new bar (the Q Bar)... and... it is exaaaactly the same lol.  I went to the Q Bar on a recent Saturday night, which is when I used to always frequent the BOC, and almost nothing has changed inside.  Here is what did change:

*No cover! :)  This is probably just a promotion for a few weeks though

*Drinks were more a bit expensive, and smaller.  BOC was known for huge, strong drinks.  This reputation is not valid anymore with the Q Bar.  3 Vodka/Red Bulls was $27, and the glasses were smaller than usual, and not especially strong

*No bench seating in the back... why would they get rid of this??

*Q Bar banner on the front

*Different bartenders.  For BOC, Saturdays used to always have extreeeemely attractive shirtless guys bartending, usually straight guys there for the tips.  Not a big deal for me, but definitely nice eye candy.  They were not present at Q Bar anymore.

*One positive change:  better dance music!  They were playing really good funky house all night, and they removed all the furniture at about 10 PM and there was plenty of room to dance.  I really liked the dance vibe!

All in all, almost nothing changed inside.  Still dark and crowded, still has the front patio area where smoking is allowed, still the long narrow dance floor, etc.  Still a good time IMO, can't complain!
author: Josh G.

description: Great music, great atmosphere and decor, great bartenders---I love this bar. My only gripe is that the dance floor is a bit tiny so sometimes it's hard to get my groove on and it's always no fun when you're pushed into other people.
author: Jessica S.

description: I like this place.  Almost always a cute crowd and good music most of the time.  I met my partner here three years ago, so "Q" will always have a special place in my heart.  Richard is a great bartender, stiff drinks with a smile.  And even though I don't go out nearly as much as I used to (wonder why?), he greets me like I'm his best regular.
author: Kevin M.

description: I don't think I've ever walked out of this place and not been a train wreck. Thanks Q Bar.
author: Corey V.

description: Very cool, kick back place. Enjoyed the two-for-one special and bartender was very friendly. Great atmosphere and good music. Only thing I would have to "complain" about is that it's cash only, but it seems that everywhere in the Castro District only accepts cash. I visited this bar as a tourist from Los Angeles and am used to just opening up a tab on my card. Other than that, great place. Casual dress.
author: Cristina L.

description:
Best Happy Hour prices in the Castro. Where else can you get a couple of Stoli cocktails - full gay bar strength cocktails I might add - for $7? The bartenders are cute and friendly. The walls are padded, which is friggin' awesome, and no particular crowd owns this venue. I see the full spectrum of gender, age, ethnicity here and I like that!

The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because I'm a grumpy middle aged man, and this place is way too crowded and loud for me after 9 o'clock. But I'll see you at Happy Hour!
author: Tim G.

description: I came here on a Monday night, which apparently is "straight night" so that took me off guard when I first came. This place has an amazing selection of music, great/fun crowd, and be aware of the $1 drinks (these are so so so so so strong).
author: Tif L.

description: The place to be on a Tuesday night... although it gets crowded early and the dance floor is small, it's always fun! Always.
author: Aimee I.

description: I went here last thursday and had a blast!!! The people were awesome, and the music was great, there was no cover too which is always a plus!!I looooove the poles that people could dance on and the drink special was buy one get one free!!! The bouncer was amazing too, really nice and cute! just like all the bartenders as well, everyone was super cool! I recomend this place to anyone, im definately going back!
author: Chelsea M.

description: castro bar scene...q bar quick cheap...even for non-happy hours....$four guinness pick...round of beers, wines and cocktails $four to $five standard pricing....fair pricing for long stay and linger...dim, dark and disco lighting....music beats and all ages...usual rainbow crowd, but easy mingling and conversing....bar stools, small tables and one large group seating area perfectly situated high for better viewing....fine pricing, fine servicing and fine night out....
author: Hen A.

description: This place is a gem to San Francisco. By far my favorite bar in Castro. Free to get in is always a plus. The DJ's know how to spin and the drinks are fab for being so inexpensive (hello...BEST Vodka & RedBulls ever!). The little smoking area up front (outside) is really convenient so you don't have to deal with leaving and then trying to get in again just to have a quick drag or two. This is the perfect club for those of us girls who are attached and want to get their grind on. As far as my man is concerned...gay club = threat free! I'll miss this place, as I have sadly, not found any place as rockin as this one in LA.
author: Alia L.

description: Q Bar is still The Bar to me except with fancier decor. I always have a great time when I go at night. I also went during happy hour and was surely happy. $2.50 well drinks and none of that smaller glasses business going on, gotta love that. It didn't get busy, in fact we were the only ones there for a while, saw a few regulars come in. The bartender was nice and didn't hold back when pouring alcohol. Cheers!!
author: Jamie Q.

description: Throwback Thursdays are awesome! Definitely my favorite night out of the week to go. The throwback music ends around midnight. Drinks are 2 for 1. My friends & I got 4 vodka/cranberry drinks for under $20! Plus the drinks are strong, what a fantastic deal. The place is always packed & it does get hot, but there's always room to place an order at the bar, and to dance. The mini stage/seating thing along the back (not even sure what to call it) is fun to dance on! Be careful though, not much room to manuever. The crowd is so nice & fun, everyone is there to have a good time without starting drama. The smoking section in front has plenty of seating, but is pretty cramped. Oh & bring cash- cash only joint.
author: Ashley Marie L.

description: Came in on a Saturday night. Had many of the 2 for 1 drink special (of course!). Easy going people to talk to. Music was alright.  Definitely would come back here again.
author: Lily D.

description: Oh shnike.  If I lived in SF you would have to pry me away from this place with a crowbar. We wandered in to a wicked happy hour (2-for-1 or drink deals), a DJ, and superior service from the 2 bartenders. We didn't mean to get wasted...but we did. Thanks Q Bar. That was fun.
author: Erin B.

description: WHOA!!! I came here on Saturday night?  According to everyone i went with, yes i did.  No cover on a Saturday?? sweet!  I don't remember much about this place other than the purple neon lights, the throngs of people i was somehow able to maneuver through to get to the ledge right under the speakers, dancing on this ledge and using the pole to keep me from falling, and taking another shot of alcohol which would have made that my 9th drink.  I sure did have fun though and dancing is good exercise.  I have to burn off those 9 drinks somehow.  I'll be back when i'm less drunk so i can actually give this place a real review.
author: Aaron G.

description: Insane, my experiences seem to always vary when I go here!  For the most part the music is always great, I love dancing and the fact I can go out on a Monday night, get dollar drinks, get wasted and party with awesome people, makes this place freaking one one of the best places ever!
author: Rebecca D.

description: Ok so I've been here a few times...nothing special...typical drinks that you could get any where in Castro...not cheaper. This time the bartender messed up on the drinks and refused to correct it.  With the current economy, I can find a few places that will be more honest. I will be going there! It's not a big deal to me, but I figured the comment was worth an effort if people are concerned where they spend their money.
author: K S.

description:
I love the new owners and they did a great job with the remodeling! I miss the old bouncer, i never see him anymore. meow.

love casey and justin
author: Casey G.

description:
feel like dancin' on a sunday night with some gay boys to hip hop? check. 
this place is tiny which can be intimate or if you want to "accidently" bump into someone cute. but at other times it can be claustrophobic. 

ladies, one toilet. always a pain but what can u do so just get in line before u really have to go.

they also have a nice patio/front area if you want to grab a seat and chat. 
i remember the drinks being a good price and bartenders being friendly.
author: Chanda I.

description:
Cash Only!!!

My Favorite Queer Club in SF has always been and will remain Qbar aka the old B.O.C. 

It's a local spot and an SF Staple. It's where you bring your out-of-town chums. It's small and personable. The lighting system is cool. The DJs are 95% of the time on point and glitch free. The tatted, dark-haired female bartender who serves next to the DJ booth is your best bet. The smoking patio is great for people watching. 

I don't mind how crowded it is until someone flagellates. 

Check out Ladies Night on Tuesday's for the Half-Off drinks all night and the sexiest bartender- next to the DJ booth
author: ebony p.

description: There's something amazing about Q Bar. 3 of my girls and I went out on a Tuesday night for GRRLS night, and even though it did not get packed, the bartenders are just awesome. One of the bartenders made something for us and kept asking us if it tasted ok, to let her know if we needed more juice, just to make it satisfactory. I LOVE that! How often do you get bartenders who really care whether or not your drink is satisfactory? And for half price Tuesdays!! The venue is really small, but I adore that they have seating along the side for ALL to sit and rest up. Music was decent, I wish they played more mainstream, but I'm no music expert. So, 5 stars for Q bar. I'd definitely go again, especially w/ girls on Tuesday nights.
author: Camille T.

description: Happy hour is great since you can sit outside and people watch. Definetly less crowded when compared to the Cafe and Badlands but there is actually AC.
author: Allen L.

description: This place is always super crowded and the restroom lines are ridiculous! Though the music is good and people are friendly.
author: wane a.

description: Q Bar is fun and has a great happy hour (2 for 1) every  night. The music varies from good to typical BAD, but it just depends on your taste and what you're in the mood for.
author: Shalana M.

description: I came here with a gay friend...didn't like it...Music sucks! and too packed
author: Kaitlyn P.

description:
* VIOLENCE IN THE CASTRO *
 DO NOT SUPPORT THIS BAR- - - PHYSICAL ASSAULT IS NOT OK

I gave one star to write this... would rather give none.

 
On Sunday I was in the Castro and decided to relax a little before dinner plans and went to get a 2 for 1 cosmo which I thought was a great deal. I drank my two cosmos outside talked to some uber sweet gboys on the patio and left to go to dinner. At dinner my date and I decided to go back to Qbar for a drink because it was still happy hour. We were seated at the bar and having a good time... but not for long. I accidentally bumped a woman seated behind me twice. The bar was really crowded and the swivel chairs are quite wide and easily in the way. I apologized and briefly patted her shoulder. I just meant it in a friendly gesture but her lady friend started tripping out and said "don't touch my GF". Both of them started *tripping* out and I turned around and ignored them. I decided to have a cigarette outside and left my date seated at the bar. I was outside for a bit and decided to go back inside... *shit hits the fan*

Bouncer: You can't go back inside!
me: Excuse me? Why?
Bouncer: YOU CAN'T GO BACK INSIDE
me: whyyyy? What did I do? My date is in there...

I proceed to try and walk past him to get my date inside and leave. 
THE BOUNCER GRABBED MY ARMS AND SHOVED ME TO THE GROUND. I HIT MY KNEES ON THE CONCRETE AS HIS HANDS GRIPPED MY WRISTS. (I have back problems and just finished acupuncture a couple days prior) I WAS IN EXCRUCIATING PAIN AND HE WOULD NOT LET GO OF ME. HE WAS STANDING BEHIND ME WHILE HOLDING MY WRISTS AS I WAS ON THE GROUND WITH MY ARMS ABOVE MY HEAD. I WAS IN PAIN FROM BEING THROWN TO THE GROUND AND MY ARMS WERE TILTED BACK TOWARDS HIM CREATING MORE PAIN. MY BACK IS IN HORRIBLE CONDITION RIGHT NOW AND I SCREAMED THAT I HAVE BACK ISSUES AND HE WOULD NOT LET GO. HE TOLD ME "the police are coming, we called the police"!!!!! My friends came out and begged him to let me go and finally after they all begged him, he let me go. I was crying and my date found me outside and we all left. 

I HAVE NEVER EVER BEEN TREATED SO BRUTALLY. THIS BAR IS A DISASTER WAITING TO HAPPEN. EVEN SECURITY GUARDS KNOW THAT YOU CANNOT MANHANDLE SOMEONE LIKE THAT...THESE BOUNCERS THINK THEY HAVE THE RIGHT TO PHYSICALLY ASSAULT SOMEONE FOR NOTHING... NOT EVEN GIVING AN EXPLANATION AS TO WHAT THE PERSON HAS DONE WRONG. I WAS NOT WASTED, STARTING A FIGHT, ETC. 


A police report will be filed against this bar. I have numerous bruises to prove it on my knees and arms.
author: Rockergrrl R.

description: I'm new to the Bay Area, and my BFF was visiting from Atlanta.  We knew we wanted to check out the Castro and were lucky enough to find the Q Bar.  We got there pretty early, around 9, on a Saturday night, and it wasn't too packed.  We grabbed a table near the bar and enjoyed some very well-priced beers.  Caligula was playing on the tv's along with some electro-dancey music.  As we made our way through another round, the crowd started picking up.  Some apparent regulars showed up including a gorgeous queen in an impossibly short mini and an intense older lady with a long gray ponytail who was there for some serious house dancing.  There was a mix of couples, groups, older, younger, mostly guys with a few gay ladies and allies sprinkled in for good measure.  As it got more crowded, Caligula left the tv's and more people started dancing.  One of the bartenders started taking away all the tables and chairs, including kicking people directly out of theirs.  A bit strange, but space was at a premium for dancing.  The people were friendly and happily unpretentious.  I would definitely stop in again.
author: Jenna T.

description:
I came here on a Friday night with a group of friends. Great atmosphere, cheap drinks, and friendly people =) I enjoyed the vibe and music. 

Minus one star because the place was...SMALL. I wish it was a little bit bigger...the dance floor at least haha.
author: Jamie M.

description: I LOVE qbar, but they decided to start charging a cover without warning their loyal patrons. So, be warned. They will probably charge you $2 to get in. Hopefully the new cover charge will help them afford to pay for a bathroom remodel. Currently, there's only one toilet for all the girls. eek.
author: Nick W.

description: I'm not sure how or why I ended up at Q Bar, but the drinks were cheap and since it was Tuesday, it was ladies night. I came here around 8:30pm, super early since my friends and I had just came from the Fillmore after the Mardi Gras parade. The drinks were 2 for 1, and happy hour is from 4pm-9pm, after 9pm drinks were half price. We ordered a couple martinis and shots then left. Even though I wasn't there for long it was definitely a cool spot for cheap drinks!
author: Pish P.

description: Dollar Drink Mondays, Ladies Night Tuesdays, and Two For One Thursdays. The dj's are really good, they mix very well. One of my favorite spots to go in Castro and they almost always never charge and if they do charge it's like two bucks. What's better than that?? Cheap good drinks and good music!
author: Nic P.

description: Awesome atmosphere, great decor, good good dance music, but its pretty small so when it gets crowded you cant get too crazy on the dance floor without knocking people around. But it definitely has a good crowd, bartenders were slammed and were moving around faster then the drunks on the dance floor breaking glasses on the bar, it was like watching the energizer bunny on crack. good times. And there is a coat check, ALWAYS a plus...cause it gets HOT and sweaty in there.
author: S. M.

description: Was there at 9:30 on Friday night. Missed happy hour, but got a specialty mango mojito anyway. It was great! A good size, very minty, with a lingering mango taste at the end. Good music, people were starting to dance. There was a very drunk couple sitting next to us who just couldn't stay off each other, and in the process kept hitting out table and spilling our drinks blah!
author: Betsy P.

description: This place is pretty cool. I went for happy hour on a Friday and the drinks were cheap and strong. Happy hour prices can't be beat. Well drinks will run you about $2.50 and called drinks will be about $3.50. The bartenders have heavy hands, which to some is a good things but it can be dangerous. LOL. I've only been to Q Bar for happy hour (I used to frequent this place when it was the Bar on Castro and I was single. LOL) so I'm not sure how it is after happy hour. It doesn't get too crowded and the interior is nice without trying to be too hip where you feel like your in a wanna be Vegas night club (see my review for Trigger). Anywho.. this is on my list of favorite happy hour haunts in the Castro along with the Bar on Church.
author: Joshua C.

description: Small, fun bar to go dancing. Downside-no sweet tea vodka. Plus side-good DJ/music.
author: Melinda Q.

description: Q Bar gets 3 stars from me because the place was pretty good, but a little small. The staff is really nice (and all really good looking!) and they make their drinks strong but delicious. They play pretty standard dance music, the standard top 40 on the radio but they also throw in some random songs there too- some oldies but goodies. They have an outside patio where smokers can lounge on sofas and chat and smoke so that's a plus for me! All in all a pretty chill place to go on a weekend night to hang out with friends.
author: Krystinne M.

description: Went here with some friends a few months ago and didnt really enjoy it too much.  I dont like it mainly because it is kinda small and the drinks are on the pricy side.  Its a cute gay bar but Ive seen better and have had a better experience else where.  Although I will admit that the restaurants around this bar are awesome and serve late night food haha.
author: Melody M.

description: 2 for 1 drink specials all day. top 40. party like its 1999 all day up in here. small indoor/outdoor-ish seating/smoking area..i fucking LOVE Q BAR!!!
author: Bailey S.

description: IF anyone hasn't been to a gay bar before, they are missing out. Leave your shitty ass homophobia in a state pen, and go have some fun. I admit, I was a bit homophobic going at first, not really knowing what it really was to be inside one, the type of gay people I would meet, and when I would get groped. Surprisingly, and to my stereotypic relief, I didn't get groped, everyone there that night were super awesome, and the music... well, let's say I need to get back there with my friends again. I was there shooting for a friend who wanted to bring me as her photographer, and thinking I would be bothered and mobbed in a rowdy way for pictures, but it was quite calm. At bag check, I talked to Brittany a lot and she was such a wonderful spirit. I would go back to just say hi to her and watch her dance. What a lady! Beautiful too, if I may add. The drinks there are pretty damn stiff, and they only take cash so come ready. The place gets packed on a Saturday night, so expect crowdedness and a restroom line. My first experience at a gay bar was well-received, quite memorable, and I unexpectedly got hit on too. =)
author: Yao S.

description: LOVED IT! excellent staff, even though it was crowded I had no problem getting a drink. After buying a few rounds the bartender even bought ME a drink! awesome! The crowd was goodlooking and friendly and I loved the music. Parking was okay- there was a parking lot across the street. I will go again with my friends.
author: Shirley J.

description: I thought I had reviewed this place before, but apparently not. I don't go to Qbar often. It's very small. On Tuesdays (Ladies Night) and Wednesdays (Booty Call) the line goes out the door down the street. But what happens when you get in? There's no place to go. It doesn't look as crowded the rest of the days, esp thurs through Sunday, so those are probably better. I've been on a Saturday and Sunday night before when someone I knew was a dancer there, and it was dead. This past Monday, Jason L was visiting SF, so we went out for dollar drinks. I am not a drinker, but he is. It was crowded in there. No line out the door, but nowhere to go once you got in. It took him forever to get drinks, and they tasted like juice. I know, because I tasted them, as did our friend. I had had zero alcohol the whole night, so any drink should have tasted alcohol-y, but this tasted juicey. I suppose that $1 is still a good deal for a cup of juice, but that's not what people are expecting, right? The music was..weird..but I was actually glad it wasn't the typical castro music. It wasn't pop or hip hop or house or rock or country, I don't know what it was. Not my kind of sound, but at least it's something different, because castro music is usually too bleh homogenous. The crowd was very young, college kids, maybe, and hipstery. We didn't stay long, my friends didn't feel like drinking all of their juice, the music was too loud to talk, and there was no place to stand. I think this is trying to be a club, which is fine b/c I love clubs, but they need more space to do so.
author: Merredith L.

description: I love this place. For once, it's nice not to get hit on by creeps. Although, the restrooms could be a little better. But, it doesn't bother enough to lose a star.
author: Amy O.

description: The manager of Q bar has been consistently driving business there for many years and I have to credit her first and foremost.  The staff is A+, always friendly (hello people if you don't want service people to be rude to you all you have to do is not be an idiot or a douche and things will work out fine).  I am a waiter, I know these things.  Just smile and be polite and not a sloppy mess and things will workout for you.  The great thing about the industry in SF is that we have the right to refuse service which is such a beautiful thing, otherwise we would be overrun by idiots.  So on with the review.  Drinks are good, I would go here if I wanted to get really drunk and not spend a ton of money, however tipping your bartender is good karma and they work very hard so I would plan on $40 per person if you wanna get smashed.  I'm a light weight by the way.  Badlands happy hour would be the other place to go for good drinks, but QBar is consistently strong and average price.  I can never say enough good things about the staff so I have that covered.  The bouncers have always been chosen extremely well, they recognize me and let me cut the line when it is all the way down the block so that is cool of them.  The crowd here is awful considering I used to party here with a bunch of gay boys my age who seem to have gone elsewhere.  I like lesbians don't get me wrong but for some reason girls are always trying to pick fights with me up in there and it really puts me off.  A girl about 4'11 got pissed when I didn't have an extra cigarette and I very politely said sorry and no and she proceeded to freak out at me and start calling me fag and put her hand at my neck all threateningly.  I was like wtf.  I hate fighting but for some reason girls in that place love to spill your drinks and then get pissed at you because it's on them and you are the man so it's your fault.  I guess I should just not come here on ladies night but unfortunately it's my only night off and unfortunately the Castro seems to be all of the sudden overrun by idiots with no manners.  So my message to people is if you're going to be a rude dumbass to a bartender or DJ or what not, don't expect them to bend over and give you a little kissy on your behind and bashfully flutter their eye lashes at you.  It is too bad that I don't feel like i'm going to a gay/lesbian bar anymore and it's in the heart of the castro.  I go for the bartenders and the music.  The people who crawl out of their rats nests for dollar well drinks on Monday (my other night off) are almost tolerable, although the friendly familiar faces are why I go to Q Bar, and how else are you going to pack out a bar on a Monday night during a recession?  Very smart in my opinion.  So go you hordes, to QBar and keep spending your money there because the staff rules and the drinks are fantastic and they know what kind of music you like.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Fun to dance at, but all drinks are .5-.75 cents more than badlands...so mine as well get your booze at BLs and move over to the Q after.  The DJ on the weekends is great, and always mixes some cool beats....small location is the only downside
author: John H.

description: rad alice party!! love bootycall wednesdays!! off with their heads;)
author: kiki b.

description: If you are looking for rude service and unfriendly bartenders...this is the place to go. I had not been in this joint in over three years since it was called the Bar in Castro.  Against my better judgment I decided to give it a try and boy do I regret it. I ordered a round of drinks for my friends and I and when I was going to pay using my card, this rude bartender tells me in a very demeaning manner, " we only take cash". At that point one of my friends pulled out cash from his wallet and paid for the drinks. As the bartender turned around to get the change, I said to my friend, "they don't have a sign indicating that they only take cash". At this point the same bartender turned around, and in a very arrogant way said "who comes to a bar without bringing cash with them". So, I told him that "it was my prerogative if I wanted to use my card, and that the establishment did not have a sign indicating that they only took cash, otherwise I would have pulled money out". At this point he tells me that I needed to settle down or else....I am never going back there again. My experience was just like the name questionable. Note to bartender: Be nice to people, or get another job that does not require human interaction. After we left this hideous place, we went to another bar, that guess what...had a note indicating that they only took cash, and I was able to pull money out and avoid any confrontations. If you like rude service, than the Q (questionable service) is the right place to go,
author: Ulices P.

description: Great drinks and music. the bartenders are super sweet. I'll come back for sure!
author: Michelle H.

description: Love it!  Although it can get ridiculously packed on weekends, its worth the trip.  The bartenders are very cute and very nice.. and 2 for 1 drinks? OH YEAA.  Q Bar has a great environment and the people are typically friendly... plus the music selection is amazing.  Makes me wanna dance dance dance the night away. Oh, and did I mention the dancers?? OMG... extremely frickin hot and absolute sweethearts!  I love how you can stick money to their underwear to tip them.  I say if you are going to spend your night in the Castro, might as well hit up Q Bar.
author: Rosa L.

description:
tried to see if there was any changes afoot at the qbar--

nope. music still sucks on saturday. crowd was the WORST I have ever seen and or smelled.  BOC was much more diverse. Now there's nothing but smelly riff-raff that goes. Maybe it will change once the cafe reopens and all the riff raff will go there again. I can only hope.

1 star still for the great bartenders.....
author: brian t.

description: my fave place to dance! usually really good hip hop and pop music (with minimal remixing) and lots of fun people. it is a tiny space, but that only makes it crazier. fun place to let loose
author: Rahul D.

description: I'm new to the area and I'm wondering if it's weird to go to a club/bar by yourself? I'm shy too so it probably would be huh?
author: D P.

description: as a straight dude who has been here with my girlfriend, i gotta say, it's the shit. the bar tenders are on top of it, everyone is friendly, and the drinks on monday night..... dollar cocktails? that's legit.
author: Q M.

description: Q bar is FANTASTIC! I loved the old BOC, (except for all those cheesy parties they started toward the end, which are now at the BOCH, aka the transfer, aka bridge and tunnel coke house... cheesy). The Q bar has the SAME super hot staff, (none of them wanted to work at the cheesy new BOCH, or with the old owner that never paid them,)  and the remodel is coming along nicely. To all these folks saying "it looks the same", DUH. They just got new owners! They are remodeling but keeping it open so everyone can see the changes, which by the way are supposed to be done by the launch party at the end of march. The smoking patio already looks a million times better than it used to! Cheap drinks, no cover, great DJ's, and great location right in the heart of the Castro. Drinks aren't the only thing those hot bartenders make stiff... And I asked a few of them how they felt about the changes, and they were all exstatic, and kept saying how they loved the new owners and how the vibe in the Q bar is so much better than it used to be. I agree, and will keep going back for more.
author: cash m.
